projecttitle: Bangladesh Rural Electrification and Renewable Energy Development Project - Modern Energy Services
project_descrip: Short: BANGLADESH RURAL ELECTRIFICATION AND RENEWABLE ENERGY DEVELOPMENT PROJECT - MODERN ENERGY SERVICES Long: USAID will continue its investment in the World Bank Bangladesh Rural Electrification and Renewable Energy Development Project to support the implementation of the Government of Bangladesh (GOB) Climate Change Strategy and Action Plan 2009 and its 2002 Vision and Policy Statement on Power Sector Reforms. More specifically, RERED-II supports the GOB's objective of developing renewable energy to provide electricity to remote off-grid areas of the country. This aligns with the GOB's goal to bring electricity service to the entire country by the year 2021. To accomplish these goals, RERED-II installs solar irrigation pumps and solar power systems in rural homes and businesses and is developing power generation from biogas and biomass.

projecttitle: Pehunco Market Gardening Expansion Project
project_descrip: Short: PEHUNCO MARKET GARDENING EXPANSION PROJECT Long: The project funds will be used to enable the Union to develop three sites for improved vegetable and potato production. longdescription: The project funds will be used to enable the Union to develop three sites for improved vegetable and potato production. Union members will use a surface irrigation system to improve their capacity to grow vegetables regardless of season.

projecttitle: UCooPMA TANGUIETA Market Gardening Project
project_descrip: Short: UCOOPMA TANGUIETA MARKET GARDENING PROJECT Long: The project will provide appropriately sized pumping and water distribution systems that will reduce the amount of manual labor and facilitate more intensive management at the two sites totaling 4.8 hectares through installation of California-type irrigation systems, improved production management, and more effective cooperative financial and administrative services.
channelreportedname: Union Communale des Coopératives de Producteurs de Maraîchers de Tanguiéta
longdescription: The project will provide appropriately sized pumping and water distribution systems that will reduce the amount of manual labor and facilitate more intensive management at the two sites totaling 4.8 hectares through installation of California-type irrigation systems, improved production management, and more effective cooperative financial and administrative services.

projecttitle: Finafa Capacity Building Project [Grantee: Full Life Society, Benin (Société Pleine Vie Benin (SPVB))]
project_descrip: Short: FINAFA CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT [GRANTEE: FULL LIFE SOCIETY, BENIN (SOCIÉTÉ PLEINE VIE BENIN (SPVB))] Long: SPVB operates a small outgrower business which works with village farmer cooperatives to produce and market rice and fresh produce.  The company will use the USADF investment to construct an irrigation system for its new production site, and to provide agricultural inputs and training to its partner cooperatives.  [Grantee: Full Life Society, Benin (Société Pleine Vie Benin (SPVB))]
shortdescription: FINAFA CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT [GRANTEE: FULL LIFE SOCIETY, BENIN (SOCIÉTÉ PLEINE VIE BENIN (SPVB))]
longdescription: SPVB operates a small outgrower business which works with village farmer cooperatives to produce and market rice and fresh produce.  The company will use the USADF investment to construct an irrigation system for its new production site, and to provide agricultural inputs and training to its partner cooperatives.  [Grantee: Full Life Society, Benin (Société Pleine Vie Benin (SPVB))]

project_descrip: Short: AGRICULTURAL WATER RESOURCES Long: To provide training and technical assistance and mobilize community and municipal resources to construct 300 watering holes and irrigate 384 hectares of pastureland for 380 Aymara herding families in the municipality of Choquecota. These activities will significantly augment the economic security of low-income herders who raise sheep and llamas in these remote communities.
longdescription: To provide training and technical assistance and mobilize community and municipal resources to construct 300 watering holes and irrigate 384 hectares of pastureland for 380 Aymara herding families in the municipality of Choquecota. These activities will significantly augment the economic security of low-income herders who raise sheep and llamas in these remote communities.

projecttitle: Servicios Multiples de Tecnologias Apropriadas
project_descrip: Short: SERVICIOS MULTIPLES DE TECNOLOGIAS APROPRIADAS Long: SEMTA will work with 400 Aymara farm families from 34 communities in three municipalities in the Pacajes department of the altiplano, on small-scale irrigation, water harvesting and the recovery of pastures. It will introduce technologies and infrastructure, offer work shops and technical assistance, and organize exchanges.
longdescription: SEMTA will work with 400 Aymara farm families from 34 communities in three municipalities in the Pacajes department of the altiplano, on small-scale irrigation, water harvesting and the recovery of pastures. It will introduce technologies and infrastructure, offer work shops and technical assistance, and organize exchanges.

projecttitle: Botshelo Trust Irrigation Project

Canaan Land will provide access to irrigated land to small producers for a small fee. Additionally, Canaan Land will provide the farmers with technical support in.return for the sale of their crops. Thereafter, Canaan Land will distribute the farmersâ€™ products through its network of partner clients.

projecttitle: Etoduma
project_descrip: Short: ETODUMA Long: Etoduma SARL is an agri-food company that processes locally grown plantains and sweet potatoes into chips. The project aims to improve the productivity and product quality of Etodumaâ€™s products to better meet the demands of the Ivorian market for plantain and sweet potato chips. USADF funds will cover the following expenses: 1) slicing and peeling equipment, 2) draining equipment, 3) bagging machine, 4) irrigation equipment, 5) working capital for the purchase of plantains and sweet potatoes, 6) packaging for Chips, 7) working capital for plantain input, 8) training on USADF rules and regulations, 9) training in best production practices, 10) local and international food quality certification, 11) accounting staff, 12) training of producers on good agricultural practices, 13) marketing and sales assistance, and 14) IT equipment.
longdescription: Etoduma SARL is an agri-food company that processes locally grown plantains and sweet potatoes into chips. USADF funds will cover the following expenses: 1) slicing and peeling equipment, 2) draining equipment, 3) bagging machine, 4) irrigation equipment, 5) working capital for the purchase of plantains and sweet potatoes, 6) packaging for Chips, 7) working capital for plantain input, 8) training on USADF rules and regulations, 9) training in best production practices, 10) local and international food quality certification, 11) accounting staff, 12) training of producers on good agricultural practices, 13) marketing and sales assistance, and 14) IT equipment.

projecttitle: Tuendelee Pamoja - Assistance and Recovery
project_descrip: Short: TUENDELEE PAMOJA - ASSISTANCE AND RECOVERY Long: Food for the Hungry is implementing a FFP-funded Development Food Aid Program. The program's primary objective is to reduce food insecurity of vulnerable populations in Katanga and South Kivu Provinces. This is achieved through Mother Leaders and Care Groups to improve nutrition and Farmer Field and Life Groups to promote improved agriculture. Major activities include rehabilitation of irrigation canals, distribution of goats/ducks, training on farming and animal husbandry techniques, value chains analysis, dissemination of agricultural marketing messages via billboard, promotion of sound nutrition and hygiene behavior, and improved access to credit. By 2016, the program will reduce food insecurity among 163,726 people in Katanga and South-Kivu and decrease the percentages of underweight children by 15 percent and stunted children by 10 percent.
longdescription: Food for the Hungry is implementing a FFP-funded Development Food Aid Program. The program's primary objective is to reduce food insecurity of vulnerable populations in Katanga and South Kivu Provinces. This is achieved through Mother Leaders and Care Groups to improve nutrition and Farmer Field and Life Groups to promote improved agriculture. Major activities include rehabilitation of irrigation canals, distribution of goats/ducks, training on farming and animal husbandry techniques, value chains analysis, dissemination of agricultural marketing messages via billboard, promotion of sound nutrition and hygiene behavior, and improved access to credit. By 2016, the program will reduce food insecurity among 163,726 people in Katanga and South-Kivu and decrease the percentages of underweight children by 15 percent and stunted children by 10 percent.

This is achieved through Mother Leaders and Care Groups to improve nutrition and Farmer Field and Life Groups to promote improved agriculture. Major activities include rehabilitation of irrigation canals, distribution of goats/ducks, training on farming and animal husbandry techniques, value chains analysis, dissemination of agricultural marketing messages via billboard, promotion of sound nutrition and hygiene behavior, and improved access to credit. By 2016, the program will reduce food insecurity among 163,726 people in Katanga and South-Kivu and decrease the percentages of underweight children by 15 percent and stunted children by 10 percent.
longdescription: Food for the Hungry is implementing a FFP-funded Development Food Aid Program valued at $9,191,290 for FY 2014, and is now in its third year of implementation. The programs primary objective is to reduce food insecurity of vulnerable populations in Katanga and South Kivu Provinces. This is achieved through Mother Leaders and Care Groups to improve nutrition and Farmer Field and Life Groups to promote improved agriculture. Major activities include rehabilitation of irrigation canals, distribution of goats/ducks, training on farming and animal husbandry techniques, value chains analysis, dissemination of agricultural marketing messages via billboard, promotion of sound nutrition and hygiene behavior, and improved access to credit. By 2016, the program will reduce food insecurity among 163,726 people in Katanga and South-Kivu and decrease the percentages of underweight children by 15 percent and stunted children by 10 percent.

projecttitle: LIFE - Integrated Water Resource Management II
project_descrip: Short: LIFE - INTEGRATED WATER RESOURCE MANAGEMENT II Long: IRG is assisting the Ministry of Water Resources and Irrigation to expand community and organizational development for integrated water resource management with a focus on sustainability and impact. The IWRM II program will extend previous successes at decentralized water management and decision-making by rural residents achieved under IWRM I. The present program results will support recent reform efforts by the Government of Egypt to help promote the sustainability of the water and waste water sectors in Egypt.

project_descrip: Short: AGRICULTURAL DEVELOPMENT Long: Asociación Mangle will assist members of 125 low-income families in the Bajo Lempa region of Usulután, many of them war veterans, some disabled. The grantee's program of community integration and development is based on diversified agriculture and aims to ensure year-round production through the introduction of irrigation systems, improving nutrition and raising income. A women's group will select and package the produce and process tomato sauce. (ES-214)

projecttitle: PL-480, Title I Loans - Development Food Aid
project_descrip: Short: FOOD SECURITY PROGRAMMES/FOOD AID Long: The agreement provides $10 million for approximately 61,000 metric tons of U.S. wheat and      20,000 metric tons of U.S. sorghum. Revenues generated by sale of the commodities in      Eritrea will be integrated into the overall development plans to improve food security, reduce      rural poverty, and promote broad-based, equitable, and sustainable agriculture. This      agreement will also devote funds to agricultural development activities, including: improving      agricultural productivity by training farmers in the use of modern inputs and practices,      supporting agricultural research, improving farmers' access to credit, storage, and marketing      facilities, developing agricultural infrastructure by constructing terraces, feeder roads, small      dams, and irrigation systems, and developing the agro-processing industry to increase the      shelf life of agricultural products.
longdescription: The agreement provides $10 million for approximately 61,000 metric tons of U.S. wheat and      20,000 metric tons of U.S. sorghum. Revenues generated by sale of the commodities in      Eritrea will be integrated into the overall development plans to improve food security, reduce      rural poverty, and promote broad-based, equitable, and sustainable agriculture. This      agreement will also devote funds to agricultural development activities, including: improving      agricultural productivity by training farmers in the use of modern inputs and practices,      supporting agricultural research, improving farmers' access to credit, storage, and marketing      facilities, developing agricultural infrastructure by constructing terraces, feeder roads, small      dams, and irrigation systems, and developing the agro-processing industry to increase the      shelf life of agricultural products.

projecttitle: Increase of irrigated agriculture from Maury to DÃ©sarmes
project_descrip: Short: INCREASE OF IRRIGATED AGRICULTURE FROM MAURY TO DÃ©SARMES Long: Farmers living in Desarmes, Lâ€™Artibonite, Haiti, often lack sufficient water for their crops, diminishing their ability to produce food for their families and earn revenue. The IAF supports community-led solutions to expand economic opportunities through sustainable agriculture and microenterprises. Our grantee partner, Association des Irrigants de Maury (AIM), is repairing irrigation systems, strengthening management practices, establishing a seed bank, and expanding farmersâ€™ access to credit. These strategic investments will increase farmersâ€™ food security and incomes.

projecttitle: Meds & Foods for Kids
project_descrip: Short: MEDS & FOODS FOR KIDS Long: MFK will engage three farmer associations, all currently supplying MFK peanuts, in testing seed varieties, fungicides, fertilizers, the feasibility of seed banks and the application of simple technologies, such as treadle irrigation and tillers. While helping the groups develop their administrative structure, MFK s agronomists will train the farmers in the use of the new products and technologies, analyze their experience and collaborate with them on proposals to apply the results on a larger scale. (HA-212)
longdescription: MFK will engage three farmer associations, all currently supplying MFK peanuts, in testing seed varieties, fungicides, fertilizers, the feasibility of seed banks and the application of simple technologies, such as treadle irrigation and tillers. While helping the groups develop their administrative structure, MFK s agronomists will train the farmers in the use of the new products and technologies, analyze their experience and collaborate with them on proposals to apply the results on a larger scale. (HA-212)

projecttitle: Certification of Community-based Water Technicians
project_descrip: Short: CERTIFICATION OF COMMUNITY-BASED WATER TECHNICIANS Long: The increasing unpredictability and poor quality of local water supply for both irrigation and consumption negatively impacts the health and food security of many communities in Honduras and can push people to leave their communities in search of better living conditions in larger cities or across borders. To increase water access and quality for rural families in Honduras the AsociaciÃ³n HondureÃ±a de Juntas Administradoras de Sistemas de Agua (AHJASA) will train and certify 100 water technicians to provide technical assistance to approximately 300 community-based water system organizations. At the IAF we support community-led solutions to expand economic opportunity in Honduras. AHJASA's activities in training water technicians support local entrepreneurship while ensuring healthy families. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America.

projecttitle: Sustainable Agriculture & Natural Resource Management in Yauyupe
project_descrip: Short: SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE & NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT IN YAUYUPE Long: G. GUIA ($193,135 over two years, counterpart committed: $65,014) in response to drought in southern Honduras, G. Guía will expand its work to three new communities, serving 100 additional families, to promote collective action towards the installation of infrastructure for water collection, irrigation and grain storage. In conjunction with five other IAF grantees in Honduras, G. Guía will develop strategies and implement practices aimed at helping farmers cope with climate change, focusing on improving food security, promoting health and reducing the pressures that contribute to migration.

projecttitle: Program for Sustainable Agriculture and Water Management Alubarén, Francisco Morazán, Honduras, CA
project_descrip: Short: PROGRAM FOR SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE AND WATER MANAGEMENT ALUBARÉN, FRANCISCO MORAZÁN, HONDURAS, CA Long: Asociación de Consejeros para una Agricultura Sostenible, Ecológica y Humana (COSECHA) In response to severe drought conditions in southern Honduras, COSECHA will help farmers implement practices to address water scarcity and increase food security, contributing to healthier families and decreased migration. COSECHA will work in 15 communities, including three that are new, in the municipalities of Alubarén, Cuarén and Reitoca in the southern region of the department of Francisco Morazán to encourage the use of farming methods compatible with the responsible use of the environment and to improve practices of water management. Forty residents will be trained as volunteer extension agents through a locally based and legally established new organization capable of providing training and technical assistance in their communities and beyond. Four innovative water retention systems will be built by local communities during the grant period. The work will benefit 450 Hondurans directly and a

projecttitle: Strengthening organizational and productive capacities of rural families and marketing of their products in the Valle de Sesecapa, Ocotepeque
project_descrip: Short: STRENGTHENING ORGANIZATIONAL AND PRODUCTIVE CAPACITIES OF RURAL FAMILIES AND MARKETING OF THEIR PRODUCTS IN THE VALLE DE SESECAPA, OCOTEPEQUE Long: Asociación del Trifinio para el Desarrollo Sostenible (ATRIDEST). Support to ATRIDEST will help address the lack of employment opportunities, especially for youth, and extreme weather- linked food insecurity in the southwestern department of Ocotepeque. ATRIDEST will carry out project activities with 140 farmers in 10 communities to improve production by setting up farm field schools to share sustainable strategies, such as integrated pest management, drip irrigation and the use of organic inputs. ATRIDEST will also work with community savings and loan organizations (or CRACs for their acronym in Spanish) to support market-driven production initiatives for their farming and community members with a goal of increasing their productivity and income. ATRIDEST proposes to use a novel approach using field schools as a method for transfer of technology for CRACs, creating mutual benefits like connecting directly to markets. The project will directly benefit 400 farmers and another 6,300 indirec

projecttitle: Improving agricultural production and access to water in Sulaco, Yoro
project_descrip: Short: IMPROVING AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION AND ACCESS TO WATER IN SULACO, YORO Long: FUNACH will work with families to establish agroforestry systems that will increase agricultural production to ensure food security and boost household incomes through activities that will also help mitigate seasonal migration and protect local water supplies. Working in eight communities of Sulaco municipality in the Department of Yoro, FUNACH will facilitate materials and technical assistance to increase yield of coffee and grains, protect community water sources, enhance water collection and use at the household level, and enrich nutrition through vegetable garden plots. In addition, FUNACH will provide training to at least 19 community groups to improve their leadership and decision-making processes. The project will directly benefit 850 people and indirectly benefit 950 people.
shortdescription: IMPROVING AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION AND ACCESS TO WATER IN SULACO, YORO
channelreportedname: Fundación en Acción Comunitaria de Honduras
longdescription: FUNACH will work with families to establish agroforestry systems that will increase agricultural production to ensure food security and boost household incomes through activities that will also help mitigate seasonal migration and protect local water supplies. Working in eight communities of Sulaco municipality in the Department of Yoro, FUNACH will facilitate materials and technical assistance to increase yield of coffee and grains, protect community water sources, enhance water collection and use at the household level, and enrich nutrition through vegetable garden plots. In addition, FUNACH will provide training to at least 19 community groups to improve their leadership and decision-making processes. The project will directly benefit 850 people and indirectly benefit 950 people.

projecttitle: Strengthening Local Capacity to Administer and Conserve Water Resources
project_descrip: Short: STRENGTHENING LOCAL CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER AND CONSERVE WATER RESOURCES Long: Junta Administradora de Agua y Saneamiento de las Aldeas de Guayabito, Cofradía, Destino, Naranjal y Jicaro Gordo (GUAYABITO) The IAF will continue to support GUAYABITO, which is working to protect local water supplies against environmental challenges, like cattle ranching, logging and mineral extraction. GUAYABITO will accomplish this by organizing community leaders to raise awareness on the importance of protecting the local watersheds and repair and install local water and sanitation infrastructure in five communities. GUAYABITO will establish a local tree nursery and reforest the local watersheds. GUAYABITO will train water boards, local leaders and water system users in water and sanitation practices, organization, leadership, and gender equity, among others, as well as train trainers to work in two new communities. The work will benefit 1,500 individuals directly and another 7,500 indirectly via cleaner sourcing of water for public and private consumption. Channel name:Junta Administradora de Agua y Saneamiento de las Aldeas de Guayabito, Cofradía, Destino, Naranjal y Jicaro Gordo
shortdescription: STRENGTHENING LOCAL CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER AND CONSERVE WATER RESOURCES

project_descrip: Short: STRENGTHENING ORGANIZATIONAL AND PRODUCTIVE CAPACITIES OF RURAL FAMILIES AND MARKETING OF THEIR PRODUCTS IN THE VALLE DE SESECAPA, OCOTEPEQUE Long: Asociación del Trifinio para el Desarrollo Sostenible (ATRIDEST). Support to ATRIDEST will help address the lack of employment opportunities especially for youth and extreme weather-linked food insecurity in the southwestern department of Ocotepeque. ATRIDEST will carry out project activities with 140 farmers in 10 communities to improve production by setting up farm field schools to share sustainable strategies such as integrated pest management drip irrigation and the use of organic inputs. ATRIDEST will also work with community savings and loan organizations (or CRACs for their acronym in Spanish) to support market-driven production initiatives for their farming and community members with a goal of increasing their productivity and income. ATRIDEST proposes to use a novel approach using field schools as a method for transfer of technology for CRACs creating mutual benefits like connecting directly to markets. The project will directly benefit 400 farmers and another 6300 indirectly including their families and members of the 10 communities. ....

projecttitle: Sustainable Agriculture & Natural Resource Management in Yauyupe
project_descrip: Short: SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE & NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT IN YAUYUPE Long: Grupo Guia will provide training and related technical assistance in communities in the municipalities of Yauype and Maraita in southern Honduras to help farmers and their families apply conservation practices, manage their water supply, plant gardens and raise small livestock for sale and household use. The work toward improving the food supply, income and the general quality of life is expected to benefit 190 Hondurans directly and another 1,300 indirectly. In response to intensely parched conditions in the drought belt of southern Honduras, G. Guia will undertake 110 additional projects, including the installation of water collection and irrigation systems.

projecttitle: Productivity & Opportunities for Development through Renewable Energy (PODER) Activity - Agricultural Sector Capacity
project_descrip: Short: PRODUCTIVITY & OPPORTUNITIES FOR DEVELOPMENT THROUGH RENEWABLE ENERGY (PODER) ACTIVITY - AGRICULTURAL SECTOR CAPACITY Long: As part of the Feed the Future Initiative, USAID is working with the Governments of Brazil, and Honduras to promote joint technical cooperation activities that will improve agricultural competitiveness, improve children's nutrition, and increase access to renewable energy in western Honduras. In western Honduras, more than 40 municipalities have electricity coverage below 70 percent. For example, in the department of La Paz, 45 percent of households have no access to electricity. In order to implement the renewable energy component, USAID will work with the Honduran Social Investment Fund (Fondo Hondurede InversiSocial, or FHIS in Spanish) on: 1) adoption of small renewable energy technologies in food insecure communities, 2) adoption of renewable energy technologies for irrigation, nutrition training centers, and small agri-businesses, and 3) provision of technical assistance and training to rural families and local organizations for the implementation and maintenance of renewable energy projects.The high-level target for this activity is to provide 10,000 poor households with access to renewable energy technologies to be used to increase productivity and nutrition. Some technologies that USAID will be promoting are small hydro-power projects focused on irrigation, small bio-gas projects linked to agricultural activities, photovoltaic systems for community centers, solar dryers and efficient cook stoves.This activity will have indirect GCC-clean energy benefits by providing renewable energy to power economic activities that will allow beneficiaries to generate enough income to move out of poverty. This will result in reduced greenhouse gas emissions, which will help mitigate climate change.
shortdescription: PRODUCTIVITY & OPPORTUNITIES FOR DEVELOPMENT THROUGH RENEWABLE ENERGY (PODER) ACTIVITY - AGRICULTURAL SECTOR CAPACITY
longdescription: As part of the Feed the Future Initiative, USAID is working with the Governments of Brazil, and Honduras to promote joint technical cooperation activities that will improve agricultural competitiveness, improve children's nutrition, and increase access to renewable energy in western Honduras. In western Honduras, more than 40 municipalities have electricity coverage below 70 percent. For example, in the department of La Paz, 45 percent of households have no access to electricity. In order to implement the renewable energy component, USAID will work with the Honduran Social Investment Fund (Fondo Hondurede InversiSocial, or FHIS in Spanish) on: 1) adoption of small renewable energy technologies in food insecure communities, 2) adoption of renewable energy technologies for irrigation, nutrition training centers, and small agri-businesses, and 3) provision of technical assistance and training to rural families and local organizations for the implementation and maintenance of renewable energy projects.The high-level target for this activity is to provide 10,000 poor households with access to renewable energy technologies to be used to increase productivity and nutrition. Some technologies that USAID will be promoting are small hydro-power projects focused on irrigation, small bio-gas projects linked to agricultural activities, photovoltaic systems for community centers, solar dryers and efficient cook stoves.This activity will have indirect GCC-clean energy benefits by providing renewable energy to power economic activities that will allow beneficiaries to generate enough income to move out of poverty. This will result in reduced greenhouse gas emissions, which will help mitigate climate change.

projecttitle: DCA Loan Guarantee Agreement - Clean Productive Environment
project_descrip: Short: DCA LOAN GUARANTEE AGREEMENT - CLEAN PRODUCTIVE ENVIRONMENT Long: With GCC-Adaptation funds, USAID/India has provided subsidy amount for this DCA Loan Guarantee Agreement with Rabo India Finance Limited. This agrement is intended to help Rabo India Finance Limited lend to Sustainable Agro-Commercial Finance Limited (SAFL), a relatively young entity with only two full years of operating experience. The loan will allow SAFL to expand its ability to lend to Indian farmers to purchase drip irrigation products that will improve water productivity in agriculture sector. This directly fits within the Adaptation Pillar for improving resilience among small-holder farmers in India.
shortdescription: DCA LOAN GUARANTEE AGREEMENT - CLEAN PRODUCTIVE ENVIRONMENT

This directly fits within the Adaptation Pillar for improving resilience among small-holder farmers in India.

projecttitle: Ja REEACH II - Clean Productive Environment
project_descrip: Short: JA REEACH II - CLEAN PRODUCTIVE ENVIRONMENT Long: USAID/Jamaica will continue to implement disaster risk reduction activities and place special emphasis on climate smart agriculture. Illustrative activities include increased rainwater harvesting for irrigation and domestic use, multipurpose agroforestry for anti-erosion measures, and better land management, to address erosion and soil loss. Technical assistance will focus on mainstreaming national and local adaptation measures to inform urban and rural community disaster mitigation strategies, coastal resource management, improved/informed planning for weather and seasons and other measures necessary to offset the negative impact of climate change. U.S. assistance will also finance capacity building, institutional strengthening and governance systems to address climate change. USAID/Jamaica's GCC activities are in line with the USAID Climate Change Strategy.

projecttitle: OTHER REGIONAL SUPPORT
project_descrip: Short: OTHER REGIONAL SUPPORT Long: USDA FOREST SERVICE HAS CULTIVATED A RELATIONSHIP WITH USAID/JORDAN AND THEIR CONTRACTOR, CAMP, DRESSER AND MCKEE (CDM). TWO USFS TECHNICAL SPECIALISTS AND AN IRRIGATION SPECIALIST FROM THE AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH SERVICE (ARS) ARE PLANNING TO TRAVEL TO JORDAN IN OCTOBER (FY2004) TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO A WATERSHED PROJECT IN QAIRAWAN, AND TO EXPLORE A POTENTIAL USAID BUY-IN OPPORTUNITY.
longdescription: USDA FOREST SERVICE HAS CULTIVATED A RELATIONSHIP WITH USAID/JORDAN AND THEIR CONTRACTOR, CAMP, DRESSER AND MCKEE (CDM). TWO USFS TECHNICAL SPECIALISTS AND AN IRRIGATION SPECIALIST FROM THE AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH SERVICE (ARS) ARE PLANNING TO TRAVEL TO JORDAN IN OCTOBER (FY2004) TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO A WATERSHED PROJECT IN QAIRAWAN, AND TO EXPLORE A POTENTIAL USAID BUY-IN OPPORTUNITY.

projecttitle: Public Action for Water, Energy and Environment (Public Action Project or PAP) - Modern Energy Services
project_descrip: Short: PUBLIC ACTION FOR WATER, ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT (PUBLIC ACTION PROJECT OR PAP) - MODERN ENERGY SERVICES Long: The Public Action for Water, Energy and Environment (a.k.a., Public Action Project) is a USAID-funded five year program, implemented by ECODIT, and intended to foster and support behavior change towards water and energy conservation and improved solid waste management. Working closely with USAID and its partners (including the ministries of Water and Irrigation, Energy, Environment, and Education), the ECODIT team will (a) put in place state-of-the-art approaches, adapted to Jordan, to induce behavioral changes related to water, energy and waste, (b) move Jordanian society closer to sustainable Green behaviors, and (c) build the adaptive capacity of Jordanian institutions to sustain this behavioral change momentum beyond the life of the project. In Phase I of the program (November 2009 July 2010), ECODIT conducted more than a dozen research activities, including a complete review of the formal curriculum textbooks, designed and organized several training workshops on social marketing and research methodology, and signed several Memoranda of Understanding including one MOU with the Childrens Museum of Jordan (CMJ). As part of Phase II (Design), the ECODIT team will design three communication strategies, to be implemented under Phase III (Implementation) using several methodologies including a multi-million grants program for NGOs and CBOs.
shortdescription: PUBLIC ACTION FOR WATER, ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT (PUBLIC ACTION PROJECT OR PAP) - MODERN ENERGY SERVICES
longdescription: The Public Action for Water, Energy and Environment (a.k.a., Public Action Project) is a USAID-funded five year program, implemented by ECODIT, and intended to foster and support behavior change towards water and energy conservation and improved solid waste management. Working closely with USAID and its partners (including the ministries of Water and Irrigation, Energy, Environment, and Education), the ECODIT team will (a) put in place state-of-the-art approaches, adapted to Jordan, to induce behavioral changes related to water, energy and waste, (b) move Jordanian society closer to sustainable Green behaviors, and (c) build the adaptive capacity of Jordanian institutions to sustain this behavioral change momentum beyond the life of the project. In Phase I of the program (November 2009 July 2010), ECODIT conducted more than a dozen research activities, including a complete review of the formal curriculum textbooks, designed and organized several training workshops on social marketing and research methodology, and signed several Memoranda of Understanding including one MOU with the Childrens Museum of Jordan (CMJ). As part of Phase II (Design), the ECODIT team will design three communication strategies, to be implemented under Phase III (Implementation) using several methodologies including a multi-million grants program for NGOs and CBOs.

projecttitle: Institutional Support and Strengthening Program (ISSP) - Water Supply and Sanitation
project_descrip: Short: INSTITUTIONAL SUPPORT AND STRENGTHENING PROGRAM (ISSP) - WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION Long: IRG is supporting the development and restructuring of the water sector in Jordan, to better meet the challenge of managing Jordans scarce water resources. Jordan confronts a very limited quantity of renewable water and a high cost of providing water to its people. Coupled with exponential population growth and rapidly increasing commercial and agricultural activity there has been an enormous increase in demand. IRG is working with water sector stakeholders and donors to implement a comprehensive reform and restructuring program for the water sector of Jordan. ISSP is addressing the key institutional constraints to more effective and efficient water resources management from policy-setting down through retail water delivery. The program works directly with the each of the governments water institutions including the Ministry of Water and Irrigation (MWI), the Water Authority of Jordan (WAJ), Jordan Valley Authority (JVA), the water utilities and the newly created National Water Policies Advisory Council.
shortdescription: INSTITUTIONAL SUPPORT AND STRENGTHENING PROGRAM (ISSP) - WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION
purposename: Water supply and sanitation - large systems
longdescription: IRG is supporting the development and restructuring of the water sector in Jordan, to better meet the challenge of managing Jordans scarce water resources. projecttitle: Water Reuse and Environmental Conservation Project - Clean Productive Environment
project_descrip: Short: WATER REUSE AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION PROJECT - CLEAN PRODUCTIVE ENVIRONMENT Long: Working with USAID, AECOM is protecting Jordan s scarce water supplies by supporting pollution prevention, water reuse, improved regulation, increased water efficiency and disposal site cleanup. Industrial facilities in Jordan use large quantities of water in their manufacturing processes, but many lack the facilities to treat their wastewater properly before sending it to municipal sewer systems or public disposal sites. With enhanced environmental management systems, clearer regulations, and improved treatment systems, this water can be used in irrigation or internally in manufacturing, which will help conserve water resources.
shortdescription: WATER REUSE AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION PROJECT - CLEAN PRODUCTIVE ENVIRONMENT
longdescription: Working with USAID, AECOM is protecting Jordan s scarce water supplies by supporting pollution prevention, water reuse, improved regulation, increased water efficiency and disposal site cleanup. Industrial facilities in Jordan use large quantities of water in their manufacturing processes, but many lack the facilities to treat their wastewater properly before sending it to municipal sewer systems or public disposal sites. With enhanced environmental management systems, clearer regulations, and improved treatment systems, this water can be used in irrigation or internally in manufacturing, which will help conserve water resources.

projecttitle: Public Action for Water, Energy and Environment (Public Action Project or PAP) - Water Supply and Sanitation
project_descrip: Short: PUBLIC ACTION FOR WATER, ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT (PUBLIC ACTION PROJECT OR PAP) - WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION Long: The Public Action for Water, Energy and Environment (a.k.a., Public Action Project) is a USAID-funded five year program, implemented by ECODIT, and intended to foster and support behavior change towards water and energy conservation and improved solid waste management. Working closely with USAID and its partners (including the ministries of Water and Irrigation, Energy, Environment, and Education), the ECODIT team will (a) put in place state-of-the-art approaches, adapted to Jordan, to induce behavioral changes related to water, energy and waste, (b) move Jordanian society closer to sustainable Green behaviors, and (c) build the adaptive capacity of Jordanian institutions to sustain this behavioral change momentum beyond the life of the project. In Phase I of the program (November 2009  July 2010), ECODIT conducted more than a dozen research activities, including a complete review of the formal curriculum textbooks, designed and organized several training workshops on social marketing and research methodology, and signed several Memoranda of Understanding including one MOU with the Childrens Museum of Jordan (CMJ). As part of Phase II (Design), the ECODIT team will design three communication strategies, to be implemented under Phase III (Implementation) using several methodologies including a multi-million grants program for NGOs and CBOs.
shortdescription: PUBLIC ACTION FOR WATER, ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT (PUBLIC ACTION PROJECT OR PAP) - WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION
longdescription: The Public Action for Water, Energy and Environment (a.k.a., Public Action Project) is a USAID-funded five year program, implemented by ECODIT, and intended to foster and support behavior change towards water and energy conservation and improved solid waste management. Working closely with USAID and its partners (including the ministries of Water and Irrigation, Energy, Environment, and Education), the ECODIT team will (a) put in place state-of-the-art approaches, adapted to Jordan, to induce behavioral changes related to water, energy and waste, (b) move Jordanian society closer to sustainable Green behaviors, and (c) build the adaptive capacity of Jordanian institutions to sustain this behavioral change momentum beyond the life of the project. projecttitle: Water Reuse and Environmental Conservation Project - Clean Productive Environment
project_descrip: Short: WATER REUSE AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION PROJECT - CLEAN PRODUCTIVE ENVIRONMENT Long: Working with USAID, AECOM is protecting Jordan's scarce water supplies by supporting pollution prevention, water reuse, improved regulation, increased water efficiency and disposal site cleanup. Industrial facilities in Jordan use large quantities of water in their manufacturing processes, but many lack the facilities to treat their wastewater properly before sending it to municipal sewer systems or public disposal sites. With enhanced environmental management systems, clearer regulations, and improved treatment systems, this water can be used in irrigation or internally in manufacturing, which will help conserve water resources.

projecttitle: Architect and Engineering Services for Water Sector Infrastructure Project (WSIP) - Water Supply and Sanitation
project_descrip: Short: ARCHITECT AND ENGINEERING SERVICES FOR WATER SECTOR INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECT (WSIP) - WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION Long: The Architect and Engineering Services for Water Sector Infrastructure in Jordan activity will provide an engineering service team with the technical services to carry out the following: engineering assessments, studies, designs, capacity building, and construction management services in the water and environment sectors. This activity will assist USAID partners in planning their resources to ensure the best utilization of Jordan's limited water resources. The exact activities will be those related to infrastructure interventions agreed upon by USAID and the Ministry of Water and Irrigation, which are critical to the water sector in Jordan. This contract is with a local Jordanian engineering firm, and is limited to a few activities due to the dollar amount.
shortdescription: ARCHITECT AND ENGINEERING SERVICES FOR WATER SECTOR INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECT (WSIP) - WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION
purposename: Water supply and sanitation - large systems
longdescription: The Architect and Engineering Services for Water Sector Infrastructure in Jordan activity will provide an engineering service team with the technical services to carry out the following: engineering assessments, studies, designs, capacity building, and construction management services in the water and environment sectors. This activity will assist USAID partners in planning their resources to ensure the best utilization of Jordan's limited water resources. The exact activities will be those related to infrastructure interventions agreed upon by USAID and the Ministry of Water and Irrigation, which are critical to the water sector in Jordan. This contract is with a local Jordanian engineering firm, and is limited to a few activities due to the dollar amount.

projecttitle: Improved Water Sector Management and Governance (IWSMG) - Water Supply and Sanitation
project_descrip: Short: IMPROVED WATER SECTOR MANAGEMENT AND GOVERNANCE (IWSMG) - WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION Long: The activity will work with the GOJ to support reform, assist in policy development and implementation and build capacity to achieve improvements and greater sustainability in the water sector. USAID will provide technical assistance to the Ministry of Water and Irrigation (MWI) and water utilities to improve water planning, management, and performance. The activity will work with MWI, the Water Authority of Jordan, and Jordan Valley Authority to improve financial sustainability, and policy formulation and implementation. Finally, the activity will help promote water conservation and water demand management by encouraging water saving technologies, curbing consumption by rebalancing water tariffs, and encouraging behavior change through outreach and education.
shortdescription: IMPROVED WATER SECTOR MANAGEMENT AND GOVERNANCE (IWSMG) - WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION
purposename: Water sector policy and administrative management
longdescription: The activity will work with the GOJ to support reform, assist in policy development and implementation and build capacity to achieve improvements and greater sustainability in the water sector. USAID will provide technical assistance to the Ministry of Water and Irrigation (MWI) and water utilities to improve water planning, management, and performance. The activity will work with MWI, the Water Authority of Jordan, and Jordan Valley Authority to improve financial sustainability, and policy formulation and implementation. Finally, the activity will help promote water conservation and water demand management by encouraging water saving technologies, curbing consumption by rebalancing water tariffs, and encouraging behavior change through outreach and education.

project_descrip: Short: ARCHITECT AND ENGINEERING SERVICES FOR WATER SECTOR INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECT (WSIP) Long: The Architect and Engineering Services for Water Sector Infrastructure in Jordan activity will provide an engineering service team with the technical services to carry out the following: engineering assessments, studies, designs, capacity building, and construction management services in the water and environment sectors. This activity will assist USAID partners in planning their resources to ensure the best utilization of Jordan's limited water resources. The exact activities will be those related to infrastructure interventions agreed upon by USAID and the Ministry of Water and Irrigation, which are critical to the water sector in Jordan. This contract is with a local Jordanian engineering firm, and is limited to a few activities due to the dollar amount.
shortdescription: ARCHITECT AND ENGINEERING SERVICES FOR WATER SECTOR INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECT (WSIP)
longdescription: The Architect and Engineering Services for Water Sector Infrastructure in Jordan activity will provide an engineering service team with the technical services to carry out the following: engineering assessments, studies, designs, capacity building, and construction management services in the water and environment sectors. This activity will assist USAID partners in planning their resources to ensure the best utilization of Jordan's limited water resources. The exact activities will be those related to infrastructure interventions agreed upon by USAID and the Ministry of Water and Irrigation, which are critical to the water sector in Jordan. This contract is with a local Jordanian engineering firm, and is limited to a few activities due to the dollar amount.

projecttitle: Improved Water Sector Management and Governance (IWSMG)
project_descrip: Short: IMPROVED WATER SECTOR MANAGEMENT AND GOVERNANCE (IWSMG) Long: The activity will work with the GOJ to support reform, assist in policy development and implementation and build capacity to achieve improvements and greater sustainability in the water sector. USAID will provide technical assistance to the Ministry of Water and Irrigation (MWI) and water utilities to improve water planning, management, and performance. The activity will work with MWI, the Water Authority of Jordan, and Jordan Valley Authority to improve financial sustainability, and policy formulation and implementation. Finally, the activity will help promote water conservation and water demand management by encouraging water saving technologies, curbing consumption by rebalancing water tariffs, and encouraging behavior change through outreach and education.

projecttitle: Jordan Water Infrastructure Project (JWIP)
project_descrip: Short: JORDAN WATER INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECT (JWIP) Long: The Water Infrastructure project activity will launch infrastructure interventions agreed upon by USAID, the Ministry of Water and Irrigation, Ministry of Environment, and other water utilities that are rated critical to the water and environment sectors. The activity provides an engineering service team and other specialized staff with the technical capacity to carry out engineering assessments, studies, designs, and construction management in the water, wastewater, and environment sectors to help our partners better plan and utilize their limited water resources. These activities will include the preparation of detailed engineering designs and tender documents for the Zai water treatment plant, the feasibility study and design for the expansion of the Ramtha and Madaba wastewater treatment plants, and the feasibility and engineering designs of new water supply resources in Jordan.
longdescription: The Water Infrastructure project activity will launch infrastructure interventions agreed upon by USAID, the Ministry of Water and Irrigation, Ministry of Environment, and other water utilities that are rated critical to the water and environment sectors. The activity provides an engineering service team and other specialized staff with the technical capacity to carry out engineering assessments, studies, designs, and construction management in the water, wastewater, and environment sectors to help our partners better plan and utilize their limited water resources. These activities will include the preparation of detailed engineering designs and tender documents for the Zai water treatment plant, the feasibility study and design for the expansion of the Ramtha and Madaba wastewater treatment plants, and the feasibility and engineering designs of new water supply resources in Jordan.

project_descrip: Short: SITE PRESERVATION Long: To support the documentation of important cultural landscapes and archaeological sites, along the Silk Route, in the steppes and desert areas of Kazakhstan. The sites will be surveyed and mapped. The expansion of infrastructure, settlements, and irrigated agriculture threatens the integrity and material evidence of the sites. Documentation will assist in the preservation of the sites.  Type:  Archaeology
longdescription: To support the documentation of important cultural landscapes and archaeological sites, along the Silk Route, in the steppes and desert areas of Kazakhstan. The sites will be surveyed and mapped. The expansion of infrastructure, settlements, and irrigated agriculture threatens the integrity and material evidence of the sites. Documentation will assist in the preservation of the sites.  Type:  Archaeology

projecttitle: Kangalita Irrigation Capacity Building
project_descrip: Short: KANGALITA IRRIGATION CAPACITY BUILDING Long: Sector: Agriculture.Beneficiaries: Post-conflict farming community.Summary: The project funds will be used to complete a feasibility study to assess the best options for rehabilitating and expanding existing irrigation infrastructure on Kangalita's farm. The grant will also fund training in ADF's required bookkeeping, monitoring and evaluation, governance and financial management, types of irrigation technologies, and an exchange visit to learn from other working farms.
longdescription: Sector: Agriculture.Beneficiaries: Post-conflict farming community.Summary: The project funds will be used to complete a feasibility study to assess the best options for rehabilitating and expanding existing irrigation infrastructure on Kangalita's farm. The grant will also fund training in ADF's required bookkeeping, monitoring and evaluation, governance and financial management, types of irrigation technologies, and an exchange visit to learn from other working farms.

projecttitle: Achukule Irrigation Expansion
project_descrip: Short: ACHUKULE IRRIGATION EXPANSION Long: Sector: Agriculture (kale, spinach, tomatoes, capsicum, brinjal).Beneficiaries: Small-scale farmers.Summary: The purpose of this grant is to expand Achukule's operations as a sustainable farming cooperative and ensure food security for its members, following the success of a previous capacity building grant. Activities will include drilling a borehole to ensure a steady source of water, building an office, and installing a new drip irrigation system.
longdescription: Sector: Agriculture (kale, spinach, tomatoes, capsicum, brinjal).Beneficiaries: Small-scale farmers.Summary: The purpose of this grant is to expand Achukule's operations as a sustainable farming cooperative and ensure food security for its members, following the success of a previous capacity building grant. Activities will include drilling a borehole to ensure a steady source of water, building an office, and installing a new drip irrigation system.

projecttitle: Lokamarinyang Irrigation Expansion
project_descrip: Short: LOKAMARINYANG IRRIGATION EXPANSION Long: Sector: Food production (tomatoes, maize, kale, water melon, and cow peas).Beneficiaries: Marginalized farmers, mostly women.Summary: The project funds will be used to sink a borehole, install a drip irrigation system, purchase certified seeds and pesticides, and to expand acreage under production. Funds will also be used to sponsor financial management, monitoring and evaluation, and business management training in order to strengthen the capacity of the group.
longdescription: Sector: Food production (tomatoes, maize, kale, water melon, and cow peas).Beneficiaries: Marginalized farmers, mostly women.Summary: The project funds will be used to sink a borehole, install a drip irrigation system, purchase certified seeds and pesticides, and to expand acreage under production. Funds will also be used to sponsor financial management, monitoring and evaluation, and business management training in order to strengthen the capacity of the group.

projecttitle: MAKOHAA Micro Hydro Project
project_descrip: Short: MAKOHAA MICRO HYDRO PROJECT Long: Magoya Konjra Hareka Self Help Group (MAKOHAA) is installing a 12 kilowatt hydropower plant (with the potential for expansion to 700 kilowatts in the future) to connect 300 households, an irrigation system, and a refrigeration system. The residents of Magoya and Rambulla sub-locations of Siaya County have experienced persistent challenges in connecting to the national grid.
longdescription: Magoya Konjra Hareka Self Help Group (MAKOHAA) is installing a 12 kilowatt hydropower plant (with the potential for expansion to 700 kilowatts in the future) to connect 300 households, an irrigation system, and a refrigeration system. The residents of Magoya and Rambulla sub-locations of Siaya County have experienced persistent challenges in connecting to the national grid.

projecttitle: Ace Africa Solar Drip Irrigation Project
project_descrip: Short: ACE AFRICA SOLAR DRIP IRRIGATION PROJECT Long: Ace Africa will install 6 solar drip irrigation systems for 6 women's groups of at least 20 women.
shortdescription: ACE AFRICA SOLAR DRIP IRRIGATION PROJECT
longdescription: Ace Africa will install 6 solar drip irrigation systems for 6 women's groups of at least 20 women.

projecttitle: YALI - Ngetich - Illuminum Greenhouses
project_descrip: Short: YALI - NGETICH - ILLUMINUM GREENHOUSES Long: Smallholder farmers in Kenya rely on rainwater to grow their crops. That is why Taita is utilizing greenhouses and drip irrigation to help these farmers expand their yield. Taitia is constructing greenhouses and providing trainings on modern farming methodologies for local farmers to help them maximize water usage and increase their production.
longdescription: Smallholder farmers in Kenya rely on rainwater to grow their crops. That is why Taita is utilizing greenhouses and drip irrigation to help these farmers expand their yield. Taitia is constructing greenhouses and providing trainings on modern farming methodologies for local farmers to help them maximize water usage and increase their production.

projecttitle: Natiira Ateni Irrigation Project
project_descrip: Short: NATIIRA ATENI IRRIGATION PROJECT Long: Sector: Irrigated agriculture .Town/City: Natiira Village .The project funds will be used to drill a borewell and lay a 2-acre drip irrigation system, renovate the office, hire office staff, train staff in good governance practices, train group members on crop selection and pest management and train staff in financial management, develop policies for finances, human resources, and procurement, and purchase office equipment and farm inputs..
longdescription: Sector: Irrigated agriculture .Town/City: Natiira Village .The project funds will be used to drill a borewell and lay a 2-acre drip irrigation system, renovate the office, hire office staff, train staff in good governance practices, train group members on crop selection and pest management and train staff in financial management, develop policies for finances, human resources, and procurement, and purchase office equipment and farm inputs..

projecttitle: TADO Sustainable Food Security for Napopong'oit Households
project_descrip: Short: TADO SUSTAINABLE FOOD SECURITY FOR NAPOPONG'OIT HOUSEHOLDS Long: Sector: Agriculture (kale, spinach, tomatoes, capsicum, brinjal).Beneficiaries: Small-scale farmers.Summary: The purpose of this grant is to expand TADO's operations as a sustainable farming cooperative and ensure food security for its members, following the success of a previous capacity building grant. Activities will include drilling a borehole to ensure a steady source of water, building an office, and installing a new drip irrigation system.

projecttitle: SHOFCO Clean Water Expansion Project
project_descrip: Short: SHOFCO CLEAN WATER EXPANSION PROJECT Long: Sector:Water and sanitation.Beneficiaries: Marginalized slum dwellers, mostly women.Summary: Support from the U.S. African Development Foundation of $150,000 will enable SHOFCO to construct and operate three clean water kiosks, connected by aerial piping, for one year. In addition to covering all costs encompassed in the project construction, this commitment will provide clean water to over 12,000 individuals in Kibera.

projecttitle: SolarGen Solar Powered Irrigation Project
project_descrip: Short: SOLARGEN SOLAR POWERED IRRIGATION PROJECT Long: Sector: Solar Description: SolarGen is a renewable energy company focused on Kenya's remote and conflict-affected northeastern region. Through the support of USADF and a debt investment from Nithio, SolarGen will open new offices in Wajir and Garissa. They will expand their current offering of solar-powered water pumping equipment via a sharia-compliant loan product. This will be highly impactful for farmers in the arid region.

project_descrip: Short: AFRICAN RESILIENCE INITIATIVE FOR ENTREPRENEURS (ARIE) - SYNNEFA ILLUMINUM GREENHOUSES Long: The same way that Amazon.com helps sellers with access to market, rating system, logistics, reverse logistics and all the other tools, Illuminum Greenhouses helps farmers. projecttitle: YALI - Ngetich - Illuminum Greenhouses
project_descrip: Short: YALI - NGETICH - ILLUMINUM GREENHOUSES Long: Smallholder farmers in Kenya rely on rainwater to grow their crops. That is why Taita is utilizing greenhouses and drip irrigation to help these farmers expand their yield. Taitia is constructing greenhouses and providing trainings on modern farming methodologies for local farmers to help them maximize water usage and increase their production.

Taitia is constructing greenhouses and providing trainings on modern farming methodologies for local farmers to help them maximize water usage and increase their production.

projecttitle: Kenya Integrated Water Sanitation and Hygiene (KIWASH) - Agricultural Sector Capacity
project_descrip: Short: KENYA INTEGRATED WATER SANITATION AND HYGIENE (KIWASH) - AGRICULTURAL SECTOR CAPACITY Long: By combining nutrition programming with improved access to water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH), the U.S. Agency for International Development has designed the Kenya Integrated Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene Project (KIWASH). KIWASH aims to enable more than 1 million Kenyans across nine counties to gain access to improved WASH services and assist households in gaining access to irrigation and nutrition services. As county governments take on responsibility for investment in and oversight of service delivery to keep their constituents healthyand their economies thrivingthere is great opportunity to expand service delivery through public-private partnerships that bring new actors into the WASH sector. KIWASH will partner with water and sanitation service providers to develop bankable business plans, improve operations, and facilitate access to financing. In parallel, behavior change communication activities linked to Community-Led Total Sanitation and hygiene will stimulate demand for improved household sanitation, hygiene, and nutrition. Our target counties are Busia, Kakamega, Kisumu, Kitui, Makueni, Migori, Nairobi, Nyamira, and Siaya.

projecttitle: Litani River Basin Management Support (LRBMS) - Natural Resources and Biodiversity
project_descrip: Short: LITANI RIVER BASIN MANAGEMENT SUPPORT (LRBMS) - NATURAL RESOURCES AND BIODIVERSITY Long: The Litani River Basin Management Support (LRBMS) Program is a new technical assistance activity funded by USAID in Lebanon. It is a 4-year program with a budget of $10 Million. LRBMS improves sustainable water resource management in the Litani River Basin through technical support to the Litani River Authority (LRA) and implementation of limited small scale infrastructure activities. Broadly, the program will provide Lebanon with a model of river basin-based integrated water resource management that could be replicated across the country. Integrated irrigation management will enhance irrigation practices for farmers, provide pollution mitigation for the river basin, and improve public health.
shortdescription: LITANI RIVER BASIN MANAGEMENT SUPPORT (LRBMS) - NATURAL RESOURCES AND BIODIVERSITY
longdescription: The Litani River Basin Management Support (LRBMS) Program is a new technical assistance activity funded by USAID in Lebanon. It is a 4-year program with a budget of $10 Million. LRBMS improves sustainable water resource management in the Litani River Basin through technical support to the Litani River Authority (LRA) and implementation of limited small scale infrastructure activities. Broadly, the program will provide Lebanon with a model of river basin-based integrated water resource management that could be replicated across the country. Integrated irrigation management will enhance irrigation practices for farmers, provide pollution mitigation for the river basin, and improve public health.

projecttitle: Lebanon Water Project (LWP) - Water Supply and Sanitation
project_descrip: Short: LEBANON WATER PROJECT (LWP) - WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION Long: USAID will continue to support Lebanon's four Regional Water Establishments and the Litani River Authority through the Lebanon Water Project (LWP). The project will collaborate with municipalities, civil society, and the local private sector in addressing major sector concerns.LWP will result in reliable and sustainable access to potable water for Lebanese citizens, improve water, wastewater, and irrigation management practices, enhance the efficiency and sustainability of the public water utilities, and, whenever feasible, respond to water and wastewater issues arising from the influx of Syrian refugees. The project will promote better water and sanitation governance as a means to long-term water resource protection.

projecttitle: YALI - Kanjadza Acres
project_descrip: Short: YALI - KANJADZA ACRES Long: The goal of Kanjadza Acres is to increase economic activity, build the capacity of residents and thereby transform the fiscal landscape of Mpingu. This will be done by tapping into the available demand in the capital city, by investing in sustainable and consistent production and processing of fruits and vegetables by using solar irrigation.
longdescription: The goal of Kanjadza Acres is to increase economic activity, build the capacity of residents and thereby transform the fiscal landscape of Mpingu. This will be done by tapping into the available demand in the capital city, by investing in sustainable and consistent production and processing of fruits and vegetables by using solar irrigation.

projecttitle: Bua Rice Capacity Building Project
project_descrip: Short: BUA RICE CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT Long: Sector: Rice. Beneficiaries: 212 Members. Description: Bua Producers and Marketing Cooperative Society Limited is a rice producing farmer cooperative based in Nkhotakhota. The USADF grant will fund quality inputs, crop purchases, training in rice irrigation scheme maintenance, purchase of power tillers, improvement its financial and human resource management and the infrastructure improvements needed for Bua to meet the requirements of the Malawi Bureau of Standards.
channelreportedname: Bua Rice Producers and Marketing Cooperative Society Limited
longdescription: Sector: Rice. Beneficiaries: 212 Members. Description: Bua Producers and Marketing Cooperative Society Limited is a rice producing farmer cooperative based in Nkhotakhota. The USADF grant will fund quality inputs, crop purchases, training in rice irrigation scheme maintenance, purchase of power tillers, improvement its financial and human resource management and the infrastructure improvements needed for Bua to meet the requirements of the Malawi Bureau of Standards.

projecttitle: Malawi Resilience Program - Agricultural Sector Capacity
project_descrip: Short: MALAWI RESILIENCE PROGRAM - AGRICULTURAL SECTOR CAPACITY Long: After two consecutive drought years in much of the country, 39 percent of Malawians require food assistance to survive the 2016-17 lean season. USAID will invest funds to reduce negative coping strategies in response to the drought and to increase resilience to future shocks. Activities will support improved management practices and the resilience of the agricultural sector, and may include some of the below: -Forestry and agro-forestry activities to increase the amount of land under forestry cover and to diversify livelihoods, -Soil and water conservation activities, -Support for fish farming, and -Irrigation development to increase the amount of agricultural land under irrigation. The objectives are to preserve Malawi's recent development gains and to increase its resilience against future shocks.

projecttitle: Tiwalere II
project_descrip: Short: TIWALERE II Long: USAID/Malawi's Tiwalere II activity is a public-private partnership between USAID and Feed the Children and its corporate partners, Nu Skin and Procter and Gamble. Tiwalere II delivers high-impact interventions targeting children under the age of five and women, with special focus on the 1,000 days between conception and age two. The activity will finance community-level workers' efforts to consult with mothers and caregivers on the care and feeding practices of infants and young children. Tiwalere II will conduct nutrition education to improve knowledge and practices, strengthen community referral and support systems for pregnant women and children under the age of five, promote adequate women's nutrition, exclusive breastfeeding, and complementary feeding through social behavior change, construct boreholes and maintain non-functional ones, facilitate the creation of open defecation-free communities and promote access to improved water and sanitation services and the adoption of improved hygiene practices, and promote bed net usage to prevent malaria. The activity has interventions in irrigation farming, winter cropping, fruit tree propagation, and orange-fleshed sweet potato cultivation. The Care Group Model approach that Tiwalere provides at the community level serves as a powerful social and behavior change approach. The approach reinforces community members' confidence and the capacity and skills to act as agents of their own development process, and it fosters self reliance. The activity will improve the health and nutrition status of under-five children in targeted districts in central and northern Malawi and is fundamental to achieving Joint Regional Strategy Goal 4.3 - sustainably reducing hunger, malnutrition and poverty in sub-Saharan Africa. Good nutrition is essential to reducing maternal and child mortality around the world and reaching the Preventing Child and Maternal Deaths (PCMD) goals.

projecttitle: N'Toba Horticulture Capacity Building Project

longdescription: The project funds will be used to improve the group?s one hectare plot by installing a new irrigation system and fencing it to protect it from roaming animals. projecttitle: Integrated Initiatives for Economic Growth in Mali (IICEM) - Agricultural Sector Capacity
project_descrip: Short: INTEGRATED INITIATIVES FOR ECONOMIC GROWTH IN MALI (IICEM) - AGRICULTURAL SECTOR CAPACITY Long: Task Order under RAISE PLUS IQC. Integrated Initiatives for Economic Growth in Mali (IICEM). This is our largest program in the portfolio and the activities under this Abt Associates contract are designed to improve and extensify agriculture in key geographic areas in Mali and to develop and strengthen markets and finance necessary for this expansion. In FY 11, IICEM was realigned with Feed the Future, focusing on cereals (rice, millet/sorghum) only and geographic zones limited to 3 regions Sikasso, Mopti and Timbuktu.

projecttitle: Alatona Water Association Business Development Technical Assistance - Agricultural Sector Capacity
project_descrip: Short: ALATONA WATER ASSOCIATION BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE - AGRICULTURAL SECTOR CAPACITY Long: USAID/Mali delivers technical assistance through the training, consultation and studies group, G-Force, a local nongovernmental organization to participating water management associations, through organizing and managing the distribution of irrigated water to farms in the Alatona region of Mali. The assistance strengthens the capacity of participating water management and water user associations and ensures an effective operation and adequate maintenance of the Alatona irrigated perimeter which was made possible through a Millennium Challenge Corporation investment. This activity uses a participatory and inclusive approach with particular emphasis on supporting women and protecting the environment. This project will indirectly contribute to the GCC sub-theme adaptation by increasing the resilience to climate change through better water and soil management systems for crop production.
shortdescription: ALATONA WATER ASSOCIATION BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE - AGRICULTURAL SECTOR CAPACITY

This project will indirectly contribute to the GCC sub-theme adaptation by increasing the resilience to climate change through better water and soil management systems for crop production.

projecttitle: Small Water Irrigation (KFW) - Agricultural Sector Capacity
project_descrip: Short: SMALL WATER IRRIGATION (KFW) - AGRICULTURAL SECTOR CAPACITY Long: The agreement with KfW will support the PNIP (Programme National d'Irrigation de Proximit&eacute,, 2012-2021) developed by the Government of Mali (GOM) with the objective of developing 126,000 hectares benefiting potentially 3 million people with an estimated cost of FCFA 396 billion ($ 792 million USD). Based on average costs for irrigation installations provided to us by the German Cooperation it is estimated that on average 12 irrigation structures (approximately 480 hectares) will be constructed over the period of 4 years. It should be noted that both the size and cost of these structures will vary depending upon site conditions (both opportunities and constraints). In addition to the infrastructure development, KfW, through GIZ will provide technical assistance and aid the communities to manage, maintain, and operate the infrastructure for maximum benefit by increasing their capacities.

projecttitle: The Feed the Future Innovation Lab for Small-scale Irrigation
project_descrip: Short: THE FEED THE FUTURE INNOVATION LAB FOR SMALL-SCALE IRRIGATION Long: The Feed the Future Innovation Lab for Small-Scale Irrigation, a project of the U.S. Governments Feed the Future Initiative, is a five-year project in Ethiopia, Ghana and Tanzania aimed at benefiting the regions farmers by improving effective use of scarce water supplies through interventions in small-scale irrigation. The project, led by the [redacted] and funded by the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID,) intends to develop management protocols and practices to reduce poverty and improve nutrition.
shortdescription: THE FEED THE FUTURE INNOVATION LAB FOR SMALL-SCALE IRRIGATION
longdescription: The Feed the Future Innovation Lab for Small-Scale Irrigation, a project of the U.S. Governments Feed the Future Initiative, is a five-year project in Ethiopia, Ghana and Tanzania aimed at benefiting the regions farmers by improving effective use of scarce water supplies through interventions in small-scale irrigation. The project, led by the [redacted] and funded by the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID,) intends to develop management protocols and practices to reduce poverty and improve nutrition.

projecttitle: Dar Es-Salam Community Gardens Project
project_descrip: Short: DAR ES-SALAM COMMUNITY GARDENS PROJECT Long: Funds will be used to plant a community garden, install an irrigation system and construct a fence.
longdescription: Funds will be used to plant a community garden, install an irrigation system and construct a fence.

projecttitle: Iguini Agricultural Capacity Building Project
project_descrip: Short: IGUINI AGRICULTURAL CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT Long: The project funds will be used to ensure a reliable water supply to the garden by setting up a borehole extraction system. Funds will allow the Union to expand their cultivation plot to 2 hectares by installing a new irrigation system and building a fence around it to protect it from roaming animals.
channelreportedname: Lithi Had El Amme / Iguini El Oula
longdescription: The project funds will be used to ensure a reliable water supply to the garden by setting up a borehole extraction system. Funds will allow the Union to expand their cultivation plot to 2 hectares by installing a new irrigation system and building a fence around it to protect it from roaming animals.

projecttitle: Berbare Agricultural Capacity Building Project
project_descrip: Short: BERBARE AGRICULTURAL CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT Long: The project funds will be used to install a new irrigation system and fence it to protect it from roaming animals. The Cooperative will set up a borehole extraction system to provide a reliable and constant source of water to the production perimeter. These activities will enable Cooperative members to dramatically increase the volume of vegetables sold and the profit earned by group members.
longdescription: The project funds will be used to install a new irrigation system and fence it to protect it from roaming animals. The Cooperative will set up a borehole extraction system to provide a reliable and constant source of water to the production perimeter. These activities will enable Cooperative members to dramatically increase the volume of vegetables sold and the profit earned by group members.

projecttitle: Gaat Teydouma Agricultural Capacity Building Project
project_descrip: Short: GAAT TEYDOUMA AGRICULTURAL CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT Long: The project funds will be used to allow the Union to expand its cultivation plot to three hectares by installing a new irrigation system and building a fence around it to protect it from roaming animals. This expansion will enable Union members to dramatically increase the volume of vegetables sold and the profit earned by group members.

channelreportedname: Union des Coopératives de Raja a Gaat Teydouma

This expansion will enable Union members to dramatically increase the volume of vegetables sold and the profit earned by group members.

projecttitle: Ganki Toro Market Gardening Expansion Project
project_descrip: Short: GANKI TORO MARKET GARDENING EXPANSION PROJECT Long: The project funds will be used to develop 12.2 hectares by installing a new irrigation system and building a fence around it to protect it from roaming animals. projecttitle: CONSERVATION OF WETLANDS & GRASSLANDS OF
project_descrip: Short: CONSERVATION OF WETLANDS & GRASSLANDS OF Long: This project will: (1.a.) Prepare a diagnosis of water uses and identify opportunities for conserving..water flows to conserve Laguna Bustillos and Laguna Mexicanos. (1.b.) Recover surplus irrigation..water through a network of drains (32 km/19.88 miles) and ensure this water flows to restore 500..hectares/1,235 acres in Laguna Bustillos, which will be protected through a Collaboration Agreement..for 20 years and to restore 300 hectares/741 acres in Rio Papigochi, which will be protected through a..Collaboration Agreement for 20 years. (2) Protect 2,000 hectares/4,940 acres of grasslands associated..with wetlands in Laguna Babicora (Rancho El Refugio) for 20 years through a Conservation..Easement. (3.a.) Train 200 agricultural producers and implement pilot projects on best agricultural..practices to reduce contamination, mortality of birds by poisoning, degradation and loss of habitat...The 800 hectares/1,976.84 acres of pilot project sites will be protected for 10 years through Private..Conservation Agreements. (3.b.) Implement better livestock practices in (8,000 hectares /19,768..acres) of grasslands associated with Laguna Babicora (Rancho El Refugio), which will be protected..for 20 years through a Private Conservation Agreement. (4) Monitor bird populations and habitats.

projecttitle: REFUGES FOR MIGRATORY ACQUATIC BIRDS IN
project_descrip: Short: REFUGES FOR MIGRATORY ACQUATIC BIRDS IN Long: Laguna Madre provides abundant shallow water habitats, including intertidal wetlands, seagrass beds, shallow bays, and coastal lagoons for 18.8% of the waterfowl that winter in Mexico and more than one hundred thousand shorebirds. The project focuses on the conservation of intertidal wetlands, where most of the migratory birds concentrate and feed on benthic invertebrates. This project will create 8.08 miles of drainage channels to transport surplus irrigation water and restore 9,884 acres of wetlands. It will protect those 9,884 acres with a 'Federal Conservation Lands' designation and a collaboration agreement with the federal agency in charge of the area. It will also reduce human disturbance, remove feral livestock, and post signs, implement a strategy for early detection and control of exotic plants, equip the Los Ebanos Biological Station to support applied scientific research, monitor habitat and bird populations, establish a permanent bird banding system, and train 900 agricultural producers in best agricultural practices.
