projecttitle: Agriculture Competitiveness and Enterprise Development - Strengthen Microenterprise Productivity
project_descrip: Short: AGRICULTURE COMPETITIVENESS AND ENTERPRISE DEVELOPMENT - STRENGTHEN MICROENTERPRISE PRODUCTIVITY Long: The Agricultural Competitiveness and Enterprise Development Project (ACED) will work on improving the competitiveness of Moldovan high value agriculture (HVA) by addressing binding constraints in targeted fruit and vegetable value chains at the marketing, production and policy levels. Complementing the upcoming Millennium Challenge Corporation (MCC) investment in irrigation system rehabilitation, ACED will provide critical market development and technical assistance support needed by beneficiaries as they transition to irrigated HVA production. ACED will also represent USAID s first substantial enterprise development effort in Transnistria and will focus on helping micro-, small and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) in the Transnistrian region grow and become more competitive.

projecttitle: MCC Fruit Tree Productivity Project
project_descrip: Short: MCC FRUIT TREE PRODUCTIVITY PROJECT Long: This Project Activity will support the upgrading of existing small-scale irrigation infrastructure and the intensification and rehabilitation of existing date tree cultivation in irrigated oasis perimeters (approximately 16,000 ha within perimeters covering 23,000 ha). The objective is to increase the efficiency of water use and other crop practices to enhance the yield and profitability of date production in the target areas. Specifically, MCC Funding will support: (i) irrigation infrastructure improvements of up to 12 irrigation schemes, (ii) studies and remedial works agreed to by the Parties to control seepage from the saddle dam portion of the Hassan Addakhil Dam on the Ziz River, (iii) rehabilitation of date trees, including the pruning, cleaning, and fertilizing of approximately 222,500 existing trees, (iv) provision and transplanting of date plants, including approximately 282,500 disease-free in-vitro date plants and 60,000 selected offshoots from existing trees, (v) technical and training assistance for producers, their families, and producer associations on improved crop husbandry techniques and the creation, training and advisory support of farmer cooperatives in management, marketing, accounting, organization and access to financial services, (vi) assistance for existing AUEAs in operations, management and maintenance of irrigation water distribution systems, and (vii) advisory support and development of business plans for date grading, packing and cold storage facilities at secondary cooperatives.
longdescription: This Project Activity will support the upgrading of existing small-scale irrigation infrastructure and the intensification and rehabilitation of existing date tree cultivation in irrigated oasis perimeters (approximately 16,000 ha within perimeters covering 23,000 ha). The objective is to increase the efficiency of water use and other crop practices to enhance the yield and profitability of date production in the target areas. Specifically, MCC Funding will support: (i) irrigation infrastructure improvements of up to 12 irrigation schemes, (ii) studies and remedial works agreed to by the Parties to control seepage from the saddle dam portion of the Hassan Addakhil Dam on the Ziz River, (iii) rehabilitation of date trees, including the pruning, cleaning, and fertilizing of approximately 222,500 existing trees, (iv) provision and transplanting of date plants, including approximately 282,500 disease-free in-vitro date plants and 60,000 selected offshoots from existing trees, (v) technical and training assistance for producers, their families, and producer associations on improved crop husbandry techniques and the creation, training and advisory support of farmer cooperatives in management, marketing, accounting, organization and access to financial services, (vi) assistance for existing AUEAs in operations, management and maintenance of irrigation water distribution systems, and (vii) advisory support and development of business plans for date grading, packing and cold storage facilities at secondary cooperatives.

projecttitle: Tadla Resources Management
project_descrip: Short: TADLA RESOURCES MANAGEMENT Long: Serving 30,000 farmers, the Tadla irrigation perimeter in Morocco supports expansive groves of citrus and olive and lush fields of sugar beets, wheat, and vegetables. But limited water supply, pollution, and population growth have put enormous pressure on the irrigation system, threatening the regions significant farming industry. Chemonics introduced 13 new technologies to improve irrigation and overall water management and worked to reform regulations and modernize rates so users would manage the valuable resource better
longdescription: Serving 30,000 farmers, the Tadla irrigation perimeter in Morocco supports expansive groves of citrus and olive and lush fields of sugar beets, wheat, and vegetables. But limited water supply, pollution, and population growth have put enormous pressure on the irrigation system, threatening the regions significant farming industry. Chemonics introduced 13 new technologies to improve irrigation and overall water management and worked to reform regulations and modernize rates so users would manage the valuable resource better

These are Nutrition funds to be used for Year 5 of the project as per the attached supporting documents. World Vision Project SCIP Zambezia is on track to achieving the targets set by USAID. SCIP has been responsive and diligent in correcting any deficiencies identified by USAID.

projecttitle: Feed the Future Resilient Agricultural Markets Activity (FTF RAMA)- Beira Corridor - Agricultural Enabling Environment
project_descrip: Short: FEED THE FUTURE RESILIENT AGRICULTURAL MARKETS ACTIVITY (FTF RAMA)- BEIRA CORRIDOR - AGRICULTURAL ENABLING ENVIRONMENT Long: USAID-funded Feed the Future Resilient Agricultural Markets Activity  Beira Corridor (RAMA-BC) supports local producers to increase their agricultural productivity and profitability while increasing their resilience. RAMA-BC aims to increase adoption of agro-ecologically appropriate technologies and practices by supporting and incentivizing the private sector to test and grow profitable business models that deliver relevant information, advisory services, inputs, market linkages and finance. The program consists of four components: 1) Behavior Change Communication, 2) Model Family Farms, 3) Sustainable Extension Services, and 4) Strengthened Market Systems. Components 1 and 2 will increase demand by raising awareness and demonstrating effectiveness of key technologies and practices, including improved seed, conservation agriculture practices, and water management and irrigation solutions. Components 3 and 4 will support supply-side improvements, leading to increased availability, accessibility and affordability of inputs and other technologies and improved private-sector-led advisory services.

projecttitle: Land and Water Management
project_descrip: Short: LAND AND WATER MANAGEMENT Long: Develop and invest in the quantity and quality of land and water resources, including irrigation and soil fertility, riparian and range management, and water resources to improve and sustainably increase agricultural productivity and incomes. This includes related land and water administration systems. [Government of Mozambique]
longdescription: Develop and invest in the quantity and quality of land and water resources, including irrigation and soil fertility, riparian and range management, and water resources to improve and sustainably increase agricultural productivity and incomes. This includes related land and water administration systems. [Government of Mozambique]

projecttitle: Self-Help Programs
project_descrip: Short: SOCIAL/WELFARE SERVICES Long: Provide financial or technical support for food-for-work or cash-for-work programs that provide temporary employment to workers suffering transitional unemployment in post-conflict or post-disaster settings economic recession and shifts in labor demand resulting from economic reform while at the same time contributing to road construction and maintenance irrigation works reforestation soil conservation. Ex-belligerents and their families are covered in the Peace and Security Objective unde [Enterprise - Non United States Unknown]

projecttitle: Sustainable, Just and Productive Water Resources Development in Western Nepal - Clean Productive Environment
project_descrip: Short: SUSTAINABLE, JUST AND PRODUCTIVE WATER RESOURCES DEVELOPMENT IN WESTERN NEPAL - CLEAN PRODUCTIVE ENVIRONMENT Long: Water, poverty, and environment are intrinsically connected - with water needed for everything from irrigating crops to running hydropower dams. But climate change is rapidly affecting the hydrological systems in Nepal - causing longer dry seasons, changing the pattern of the monsoon, reducing recharge of underground aquifers, and bringing disasters like floods and droughts.In Nepal, there is very little coordination between various water resources management agencies to maximize optimal and sustainable water uses for various sectors. There is also a shortage of scientific evidence to measure and predict current and future water resources, especially under climate change scenarios.
shortdescription: SUSTAINABLE, JUST AND PRODUCTIVE WATER RESOURCES DEVELOPMENT IN WESTERN NEPAL - CLEAN PRODUCTIVE ENVIRONMENT

There is also a shortage of scientific evidence to measure and predict current and future water resources, especially under climate change scenarios.

projecttitle: Business development for the strengthening of economic initiatives of producer families that participate in agro-ecological processes, community management and value chains in order to improve the quality of life of rural families
project_descrip: Short: BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT FOR THE STRENGTHENING OF ECONOMIC INITIATIVES OF PRODUCER FAMILIES THAT PARTICIPATE IN AGRO-ECOLOGICAL PROCESSES, COMMUNITY MANAG Long: Small-scale farmers in southwestern Nicaragua struggle to sustain agricultural production and maintain their livelihoods due to water shortages caused by prolonged droughts and an upsurge in extreme weather events in the region. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions that improve food security, promote sustainable agriculture, and expand economic opportunity in Nicaragua. Our grantee partner, Asociación Nochari (Nochari), works with producers to train them in organic production techniques, improve their access to native seeds like yucca and guineo (bananas), and sell their crops collectively in local and regional markets. Nochari is also collaborating closely with communities to address water shortages by building and repairing wells and evaluating low-cost irrigation systems.

projecttitle: CARUSALO
project_descrip: Short: CARUSALO Long: CARUSALO will provide four groups of farmers in Boaco training, technical assistance and credit toward improving their production of beans, rice, vegetables and dragon fruit. It will support the farmers efforts to apply new irrigation technologies, construct crop-collection centers and a greenhouse, and pool their crops to market in volume to wholesalers in Managua.
longdescription: CARUSALO will provide four groups of farmers in Boaco training, technical assistance and credit toward improving their production of beans, rice, vegetables and dragon fruit. It will support the farmers efforts to apply new irrigation technologies, construct crop-collection centers and a greenhouse, and pool their crops to market in volume to wholesalers in Managua.

shortdescription: BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT FOR THE STRENGTHENING OF ECONOMIC INITIATIVES OF PRODUCER FAMILIES THAT PARTICIPATE IN AGRO-ECOLOGICAL PROCESSES, COMMUNITY MANAG
longdescription: Small-scale farmers in southwestern Nicaragua struggle to sustain agricultural production and maintain their livelihoods due to water shortages caused by prolonged droughts and an upsurge in extreme weather events in the region. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions that improve food security, promote sustainable agriculture, and expand economic opportunity in Nicaragua. Our grantee partner, Asociación Nochari (Nochari), works with producers to train them in organic production techniques, improve their access to native seeds like yucca and guineo (bananas), and sell their crops collectively in local and regional markets. Nochari is also collaborating closely with communities to address water shortages by building and repairing wells and evaluating low-cost irrigation systems.

projecttitle: Business development for the strengthening of economic initiatives of producer families that participate in agro-ecological processes, community management and value chains in order to improve the quality of life of rural families

At the IAF we support community-led solutions that improve food security promote sustainable agriculture and expand economic opportunity in Nicaragua. Our grantee partner AsociaciÃ³n Nochari (Nochari) works with producers to train them in organic production techniques improve their access to native seeds like yucca and guineo (bananas) and sell their crops collectively in local and regional markets. Nochari is also collaborating closely with communities to address water shortages by building and repairing wells and evaluating low-cost irrigation systems.

Nochari is also collaborating closely with communities to address water shortages by building and repairing wells and evaluating low-cost irrigation systems.

projecttitle: CARUSALO
project_descrip: Short: CARUSALO Long: CARUSALO will provide four groups of farmers in Boaco training, technical assistance and credit toward improving their production of beans, rice, vegetables and dragon fruit. It will support the farmers efforts to apply new irrigation technologies, construct crop-collection centers and a greenhouse, and pool their crops to market in volume to wholesalers in Managua.
longdescription: CARUSALO will provide four groups of farmers in Boaco training, technical assistance and credit toward improving their production of beans, rice, vegetables and dragon fruit. It will support the farmers efforts to apply new irrigation technologies, construct crop-collection centers and a greenhouse, and pool their crops to market in volume to wholesalers in Managua.

Activities included herein should be linked to relevant IIP/Health, EG/Environment, and/or EG/Infrastructure activities for surrounding communities.

projecttitle: Tondi-Gada Women Rice Production and Processing Project
project_descrip: Short: TONDI-GADA WOMEN RICE PRODUCTION AND PROCESSING PROJECT Long: Sector: Rice Beneficiaries: 220 (98 women) Description: .The grant will enable TGWMCA and its member farmers to produce 200ha of paddy (FARO 44 and FARO 46). The trainings and technical support to be provided through the grant will enable achievement of optimal yields from the farms. Paddy will be produced both under rain-fed and dry seasons conditions through irrigation. Paddy harvested will be packaged and bulked in the warehouse to be constructed under the proposed project. The bulked produce will be marketed to large scale commercial rice mills and other off-takers located in the project area. In addition, TGWMCA will establish two demonstration farms which will serve as farmer field schools where members will be trained on rice production good agronomic practices (GAP).
shortdescription: TONDI-GADA WOMEN RICE PRODUCTION AND PROCESSING PROJECT
longdescription: Sector: Rice Beneficiaries: 220 (98 women) Description: .The grant will enable TGWMCA and its member farmers to produce 200ha of paddy (FARO 44 and FARO 46). The trainings and technical support to be provided through the grant will enable achievement of optimal yields from the farms. Paddy will be produced both under rain-fed and dry seasons conditions through irrigation. Paddy harvested will be packaged and bulked in the warehouse to be constructed under the proposed project. The bulked produce will be marketed to large scale commercial rice mills and other off-takers located in the project area. In addition, TGWMCA will establish two demonstration farms which will serve as farmer field schools where members will be trained on rice production good agronomic practices (GAP).

projecttitle: Social Assistance - Self-Help Programs
project_descrip: Short: SOCIAL ASSISTANCE - SELF-HELP PROGRAMS Long: Social Assistance - Provide financial or technical support for food-for-work or cash-for-work programs that provide temporary employment to workers suffering transitional unemployment in post-conflict or post-disaster settings, economic recession, and shifts in labor demand resulting from economic reform, while at the same time contributing to road construction and maintenance, irrigation works, reforestation, soil conservation. Ex-belligerents and their families are covered in the Peace and Security Objective under the Reintegration sub-element under the Disarmament, Demobilization, and Reintegration element.

projecttitle: Agriculture Recovery Project - Assistance and Recovery
project_descrip: Short: AGRICULTURE RECOVERY PROJECT - ASSISTANCE AND RECOVERY Long: The project aimed to provide emergency livelihood assistance to support 2010 flood-affected vulnerable farmers in Pakistan in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Punjab and Balochistan. The main objectives of the project were to (1) provide wheat seed packages for vulnerable households, (2) provide assistance to maintain the health and nutrition of surviving livestock in the near-term through fodder and vaccination provision, (3) provide Sorghum seed for farmers who need the crop to supplement feed for livestock and (4) provide assistance, in the form of cash for work, to stimulate community participation in the initial repair of damaged portions of the irrigation distribution system. This action not only provides an infusion of much needed cash into affected communities, it makes it possible for irrigation water to reach planted wheat acreage by the time such irrigation is needed. In Balochistan, the program is implemented in three of the four severely flood-affected provinces covering 22 districts

projecttitle: Tubewell Efficiency Improvement Program (TWEIP) Phase II - Modern Energy Services
project_descrip: Short: TUBEWELL EFFICIENCY IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (TWEIP) PHASE II - MODERN ENERGY SERVICES Long: Tubewell Efficiency Improvement Program (TWEIP) is intended to replace agriculture tube wells with more efficient one. Main goal of the programme is to demonstrate the potential to significantly improve the efficiency of the use of electricity in the words largest irrigation-base agriculture system.

projecttitle: Environmental Assessment of Kuram Tangi Dam Construction (EAKTDC) - Modern Energy Services
project_descrip: Short: ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT OF KURAM TANGI DAM CONSTRUCTION (EAKTDC) - MODERN ENERGY SERVICES Long: The Environmental Assessment (EA) of Kuram Tangi Dame construction (EAKTDC) project is being carried out to provide Environmental documentation pertinent to the proposed project as required under 22 CFR 216. The proposed Dam is to be built in Northern Waziristan Agency of Federally Administered Tribal Area (FARA) and is of high priority for the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP) provincial increased irrigation, and local employment opportunities during and after dam construction. It is envisioned that the economic benefits of the project may reduce security risks for the 3.4 million people living in this challenging area. The project has the full support of the Water and Power Development Authority of Pakistan (WAPDA).

projecttitle: Satpara Irrigation Project - Agricultural Sector Capacity
project_descrip: Short: SATPARA IRRIGATION PROJECT - AGRICULTURAL SECTOR CAPACITY Long: Satpara Irrigation & Agriculture Development Project (SIADP) is a follow up of the already existing Satpara Dam Project being implemented by the USAID Energy Office. The project is constructing an on-farm irrigation system on 15,500 acres of land downstream from the Satpara Dam in Skardu, Gilgit-Baltistan, to increase the supply of irrigation water, introduce drip and sprinkle irrigation technologies, increase the availability of fodder and the productivity of high-value fruits and vegetables. It is developing processing facilities, introducing new varieties of fruits and vegetables, and training farmers in harvest and post-harvest management.
shortdescription: SATPARA IRRIGATION PROJECT - AGRICULTURAL SECTOR CAPACITY
longdescription: Satpara Irrigation & Agriculture Development Project (SIADP) is a follow up of the already existing Satpara Dam Project being implemented by the USAID Energy Office. The project is constructing an on-farm irrigation system on 15,500 acres of land downstream from the Satpara Dam in Skardu, Gilgit-Baltistan, to increase the supply of irrigation water, introduce drip and sprinkle irrigation technologies, increase the availability of fodder and the productivity of high-value fruits and vegetables. It is developing processing facilities, introducing new varieties of fruits and vegetables, and training farmers in harvest and post-harvest management.

projecttitle: Construction Monitoring and Evaluation Program (CMEP) - Transport Services
project_descrip: Short: CONSTRUCTION MONITORING AND EVALUATION PROGRAM (CMEP) - TRANSPORT SERVICES Long: The Province of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa suffered heavy infrastructure damages firstly due to terrorism and militancy and thereafter due to the unprecedented floods of July 2010. United States Agency for International Development (USAID) actively supported the rehabilitation and reconstruction activities of damaged schools, health facilities, drinking water supply schemes and other infrastructure components in Malakand Division by initially obligating funds amounting to USD 36 million under an Activity Agreement (No. 391-011) signed in September, 2009 between USAID and PaRRSA on behalf of GoP. Expanding its portfolio, USAID provided funds for rehabilitation / reconstruction of other infrastructure components including irrigation, bridges and roads etc. in the calamity hit areas. In June 2012, USAID sub-obligated additional funds for reconstruction of rains / floods damaged and bomb blasted schools in the affected districts of KP under Amended Activity Agreement No. 391-014. M/ AGES Consultants was assigned the task of Monitoring & Evaluation (M&E) services of these reconstruction activities under USAID/Pakistan Construction Monitoring and Evaluation Program (CMEP), for which a formal contract was signed on September 30, 2012.

M/ AGES Consultants was assigned the task of Monitoring & Evaluation (M&E) services of these reconstruction activities under USAID/Pakistan Construction Monitoring and Evaluation Program (CMEP), for which a formal contract was signed on September 30, 2012.

United States Agency for International Development (USAID) actively supported the rehabilitation and reconstruction activities of damaged schools, health facilities, drinking water supply schemes and other infrastructure components in Malakand Division by initially obligating funds amounting to USD 36 million under an Activity Agreement (No. 391-011) signed in September, 2009 between USAID and PaRRSA on behalf of GoP. Expanding its portfolio, USAID provided funds for rehabilitation / reconstruction of other infrastructure components including irrigation, bridges and roads etc. in the calamity hit areas. In June 2012, USAID sub-obligated additional funds for reconstruction of rains / floods damaged and bomb blasted schools in the affected districts of KP under Amended Activity Agreement No. 391-014. M/ AGES Consultants was assigned the task of Monitoring & Evaluation (M&E) services of these reconstruction activities under USAID/Pakistan Construction Monitoring and Evaluation Program (CMEP), for which a formal contract was signed on September 30, 2012.

projecttitle: Satpara Irrigation Project - Agricultural Sector Capacity
project_descrip: Short: SATPARA IRRIGATION PROJECT - AGRICULTURAL SECTOR CAPACITY Long: Satpara Irrigation & Agriculture Development Project (SIADP) is a follow up of the already existing Satpara Dam Project being implemented by the USAID Energy Office. The project is constructing an on-farm irrigation system on 15,500 acres of land downstream from the Satpara Dam in Skardu, Gilgit-Baltistan, to increase the supply of irrigation water, introduce drip and sprinkle irrigation technologies, increase the availability of fodder and the productivity of high-value fruits and vegetables. It is developing processing facilities, introducing new varieties of fruits and vegetables, and training farmers in harvest and post-harvest management.

projecttitle: Environmental Assessment of Kuram Tangi Dam Construction (EAKTDC)
project_descrip: Short: ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT OF KURAM TANGI DAM CONSTRUCTION (EAKTDC) Long: The Environmental Assessment (EA) of Kuram Tangi Dame construction (EAKTDC) project is being carried out to provide Environmental documentation pertinent to the proposed project as required under 22 CFR 216. The proposed Dam is to be built in Northern Waziristan Agency of Federally Administered Tribal Area (FARA) and is of high priority for the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP) provincial increased irrigation, and local employment opportunities during and after dam construction. It is envisioned that the economic benefits of the project may reduce security risks for the 3.4 million people living in this challenging area. The project has the full support of the Water and Power Development Authority of Pakistan (WAPDA).

projecttitle: Gomal Zam Command Area Development Project - Agricultural Sector Capacity
project_descrip: Short: GOMAL ZAM COMMAND AREA DEVELOPMENT PROJECT - AGRICULTURAL SECTOR CAPACITY Long: The Gomal Zam Dam Command Area Development Project seeks to ensure that the water available for 191,000 acres in the command area is used efficiently through the integrated development of the command area, farm water management, productivity enhancement, value addition, processing, and effective marketing.  The project will build the physical system and train operators for the modern farming irrigation system.  An estimated 30,000 families, or approximately 195,000 people, will directly benefit from development of the command area.

project_descrip: Short: AGRICULTURAL WATER RESOURCES Long: FUNSUPO will offer training and technical assistance in the community of Boo Yala in the district of Arraiján, approximately 12 kilometers from Panama City, toward the development of a water system, a bamboo nursery, reforestation and construction of community buildings, and toward strengthening community committees and micro-businesses. The project will reach approximately 3,000 beneficiaries and their families, mainly of indigenous Kuna descent. (PN283)

The project will reach approximately 3,000 beneficiaries and their families, mainly of indigenous Kuna descent. (PN283)

The project will reach approximately 3,000 beneficiaries and their families, mainly of indigenous Kuna descent. (PN283)

projecttitle: Integrated System for Sustainable horticultural Production
project_descrip: Short: INTEGRATED SYSTEM FOR SUSTAINABLE HORTICULTURAL PRODUCTION Long: Tierra Nueva Asociación Civil in Paraguay (TN). TN will work with four associations of farmers to develop the organizations, improve production through the application of agroecological practices and boost marketing via stronger alliances with the private and public sectors. The program includes the introduction of biodigester technology to aid in the production of organic fertilizer and biofuel and the installation of irrigation systems and greenhouses to further aid with diversification. Some 250 Paraguayans should benefit directly and another 1,000 indirectly.

projecttitle: INSTITUTO PROMOCIÓN Y DESARROLLO AGRARIO (IPDA)
project_descrip: Short: AGRICULTURAL SERVICES Long: IPDA WILL UNDERTAKE A PROJECT IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE ASSOCIATION OF USERS OF THE RIMAC RIVER IRRIGATION DISTRICT TO INCREASE THE PRODUCTION AND INCOME OF 5,000 FARMERS ON THE EASTERN FRINGE OF METROPOLITAN LIMA. THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE INTRODUCTION OF A NEW, MORE EFFICIENT IRRIGATION TECHNOLOGY, TRAINING IN ITS INSTALLATION AND USE, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN INTENSIVE CROP PRODUCTION AND SMALL LIVESTOCK HUSBANDRY, AND PROCESSING AND MARKETING SERVICES FOR THE FARMERS HARVESTS.
longdescription: IPDA WILL UNDERTAKE A PROJECT IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE ASSOCIATION OF USERS OF THE RIMAC RIVER IRRIGATION DISTRICT TO INCREASE THE PRODUCTION AND INCOME OF 5,000 FARMERS ON THE EASTERN FRINGE OF METROPOLITAN LIMA. THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE INTRODUCTION OF A NEW, MORE EFFICIENT IRRIGATION TECHNOLOGY, TRAINING IN ITS INSTALLATION AND USE, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN INTENSIVE CROP PRODUCTION AND SMALL LIVESTOCK HUSBANDRY, AND PROCESSING AND MARKETING SERVICES FOR THE FARMERS HARVESTS.

project_descrip: Short: AGRICULTURAL DEVELOPMENT Long: three years, to expand agro-ecological production and marketing through agricultural and forest-based crop diversification, irrigation, and improved harvest and post-harvest practices, and to increase the community's capacity for locally-controlled economic development through title to land, the creation of household and community enterprises, and training in strategic planning and management.
longdescription: three years, to expand agro-ecological production and marketing through agricultural and forest-based crop diversification, irrigation, and improved harvest and post-harvest practices, and to increase the community's capacity for locally-controlled economic development through title to land, the creation of household and community enterprises, and training in strategic planning and management.

projecttitle: Instituto Promoción y Desarrollo Agrario (IPDA)
project_descrip: Short: INSTITUTO PROMOCIÓN Y DESARROLLO AGRARIO (IPDA) Long: IPDA will undertake a project in partnership with the Association of Users of the Rimac River Irrigation District to increase the production and income of 5,000 farmers on the eastern fringe of metropolitan Lima. The project will include the introduction of a new, more efficient irrigation technology, training in its installation and use, technical assistance in intensive crop production and small livestock husbandry, and processing and marketing services for the farmers harvests.
longdescription: IPDA will undertake a project in partnership with the Association of Users of the Rimac River Irrigation District to increase the production and income of 5,000 farmers on the eastern fringe of metropolitan Lima. The project will include the introduction of a new, more efficient irrigation technology, training in its installation and use, technical assistance in intensive crop production and small livestock husbandry, and processing and marketing services for the farmers harvests.

projecttitle: Strengthening the management of production, organization and business administrati on of small-scale banana producers in the province of Piura region
project_descrip: Short: STRENGTHENING THE MANAGEMENT OF PRODUCTION, ORGANIZATION AND BUSINESS ADMINISTRATI ON OF SMALL-SCALE BANANA PRODUCERS IN THE PROVINCE OF PIURA REGION Long: Asociación Promoción de la Gestión Rural Económica y Social (PROGRESO). PROGRESO will help 378 producers from two associations from the Piura Region increase their income by improving their production of organically grown bananas and their sales to the export market. Training and technical assistance and will enable the farmers to develop their associations, qualify for certification of their bananas as Fairtrade and organic, invest in irrigation systems and processing facilities, and access public funds. This project will benefit 378 directly and 1,500 indirectly.

projecttitle: Tomato Production and Capacity Building Pilot
project_descrip: Short: TOMATO PRODUCTION AND CAPACITY BUILDING PILOT Long: Sector: Agriculture - Tomato .Beneficiaries: 53 (including 28 women).Description: The project will enable the group to improve its financial and administrative capacity to address its irrigation, production, and transportation problems that keep the group from taking advantage of existing market demand for tomatoes in the southern Lake Kivu area.

projecttitle: Thilène Market Gardening Project
project_descrip: Short: THILÈNE MARKET GARDENING PROJECT Long: The project funds will be used to establish a irrigation system and develop 35 hectares of landin addition to the 150 hectares that it already cultivates. The funds will also be used to rehabilitate the feeder canal and establish a revolving fund to purchase rice for processing.

project_descrip: Short: GIE KATAMA CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT Long: Sector: Horticulture (vegetables, papaya, and tree crops (citrus, mango)).Beneficiaries: 20 members, up to 60 seasonal laborers.The project funds will be used to enable the group to develop twelve hectares of land for improved vegetable and fruit production. The group will use a surface irrigation system which will improve their capacity to grow vegetables regardless of season..

projecttitle: Yakaar Rice and Market Gardening Capacity Building Project
project_descrip: Short: YAKAAR RICE AND MARKET GARDENING CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT Long: Sector: Irrigated agriculture.Beneficiaries: 190 (150 women).Description: The project will improve the group's financial, administrative and technical capacity to develop and manage their irrigated perimeter.
shortdescription: YAKAAR RICE AND MARKET GARDENING CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT
longdescription: Sector: Irrigated agriculture.Beneficiaries: 190 (150 women).Description: The project will improve the group's financial, administrative and technical capacity to develop and manage their irrigated perimeter.

projecttitle: Gardening Capacity Building Project
project_descrip: Short: GARDENING CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT Long: Sector: Vegetable production.Beneficiaries 87 women.Description: The project will focus on improving the group's financial, administrative and technical management capacity, and development of a 5 ha perimeter by making water available, putting in place an appropriate irrigation system, construction of a fence, and establishment of a fund to provide production inputs.
longdescription: Sector: Vegetable production.Beneficiaries 87 women.Description: The project will focus on improving the group's financial, administrative and technical management capacity, and development of a 5 ha perimeter by making water available, putting in place an appropriate irrigation system, construction of a fence, and establishment of a fund to provide production inputs.

projecttitle: Bokk Doole Irrigated Horticulture Expansion Project
project_descrip: Short: BOKK DOOLE IRRIGATED HORTICULTURE EXPANSION PROJECT Long: Sector: Horticulture (irrigated).Beneficiaries: 324 (323 women).Description: The group seeks to expand its irrigation infrastructure and fence to increase the area under production from 3 to 7 hectares, and obtain adequate working capital for inputs, recruitment of a to expand the number of persons with access to plots and increase production quantity and quality.
shortdescription: BOKK DOOLE IRRIGATED HORTICULTURE EXPANSION PROJECT
channelreportedname: GIE Bokk Doole de Maka Sarr
longdescription: Sector: Horticulture (irrigated).Beneficiaries: 324 (323 women).Description: The group seeks to expand its irrigation infrastructure and fence to increase the area under production from 3 to 7 hectares, and obtain adequate working capital for inputs, recruitment of a to expand the number of persons with access to plots and increase production quantity and quality.

projecttitle: Rice Paddy Production
project_descrip: Short: RICE PADDY PRODUCTION Long: Sector: Rice.Beneficiaries: 109 (7 women).Description: The group seeks to install an irrigation system with drainage to increase area under production from 72 ha to 190 ha, conduct two campaigns per year as opposed to only one at present, increase average yield from 5.7 T/ha to 6.1 T/ha based on improved water access and reduced salinization plus training in best production practices, and improve management and financial capacity skills.
longdescription: Sector: Rice.Beneficiaries: 109 (7 women).Description: The group seeks to install an irrigation system with drainage to increase area under production from 72 ha to 190 ha, conduct two campaigns per year as opposed to only one at present, increase average yield from 5.7 T/ha to 6.1 T/ha based on improved water access and reduced salinization plus training in best production practices, and improve management and financial capacity skills.

projecttitle: Rice and Tomato Production Expansion
project_descrip: Short: RICE AND TOMATO PRODUCTION EXPANSION Long: Sector: Rice.Beneficiaries: 177 (66 women).Description: The group will install a pump on the Senegal River and construct an irrigation system to increase access to water and increase the area under production from 70 to 127 ha and improve soil quality by reducing salinization. Average yields are expected to increase from 5 to 6.1 T/ha due to improved water access and reduced salinization and training in improved production techniques..
longdescription: Sector: Rice.Beneficiaries: 177 (66 women).Description: The group will install a pump on the Senegal River and construct an irrigation system to increase access to water and increase the area under production from 70 to 127 ha and improve soil quality by reducing salinization. Average yields are expected to increase from 5 to 6.1 T/ha due to improved water access and reduced salinization and training in improved production techniques..

projecttitle: Irrigated Agriculture and Onion Storage
project_descrip: Short: IRRIGATED AGRICULTURE AND ONION STORAGE Long: Sector: Onion/Vegetables.Beneficiaries: 1491 (1378 women).Description: The project will install solar pumping systems to improve members' access to water to increase the area of crops under irrigated production from 13.5 ha to 18 ha, obtain training in best production and post-harvest handling practices for onions to increase yields, and construct a warehouse to stock onions to defer sales to obtain higher prices. The project will also build the cooperative management's business skills and overall capacity, and will result in the production of a sustainability plan for the organization. // Channel of delivery: Association for the Promotion of Market Gardening in Burkina Faso (Association pour la promotion du maraîchage au Burkina Faso)
channelreportedname: Association for the Promotion of Market Gardening in Burkina Faso
longdescription: Sector: Onion/Vegetables.Beneficiaries: 1491 (1378 women).Description: The project will install solar pumping systems to improve members' access to water to increase the area of crops under irrigated production from 13.5 ha to 18 ha, obtain training in best production and post-harvest handling practices for onions to increase yields, and construct a warehouse to stock onions to defer sales to obtain higher prices. The project will also build the cooperative management's business skills and overall capacity, and will result in the production of a sustainability plan for the organization. // Channel of delivery: Association for the Promotion of Market Gardening in Burkina Faso (Association pour la promotion du maraîchage au Burkina Faso)

projecttitle: ASREAD Bokk Doole Farmers' Project [Grantee: Senegalese Association of Research, Survey, and Development Support (ASREAD)/ Bokk Doole Economic Interest Group]
project_descrip: Short: ASREAD BOKK DOOLE FARMERS' PROJECT [GRANTEE: SENEGALESE ASSOCIATION OF RESEARCH, SURVEY, AND DEVELOPMENT SUPPORT (ASREAD)/ BOKK DOOLE ECONOMIC INTERE Long: The project supports sustainable irrigated agriculture in the Keur Momar Sarr Administrative District all along Lake de Guiers. It will improve the living conditions of the inhabitants as a result of substantial revenues to be earned. Local employment will increase, agricultural operations will be more credible with regard to the financing and the economy of the Administrative District will expand with the help of an enlarged market. [Grantee: Senegalese Association of Research, Survey, and Development Support (ASREAD)/ Bokk Doole Economic Interest Group]

project_descrip: Short: RECON ENERGY : SOLAR IRRIGATION SYSTEM EXPANSION PROJECT Long: 140 beneficiaries, 70 women beneficiaries. Majority woman and youth owned business. Recon Energy aims to increase its sales revenue by purchasing mobile solar irrigation systems and tractors and renting the systems to 20 local farmers in rural Somalia to increase their food crop yields.

project_descrip: Short: ACADEMY FOR WOMEN ENTREPRENEURS (AWE) : REA JALA VEGETABLE PRODUCTION CAPACITY BUILDING Long: 12,015 beneficiaries, 6,000 women. projecttitle: Kuru-ko Wate Commercial Vegetables Capacity Building Project
project_descrip: Short: KURU-KO WATE COMMERCIAL VEGETABLES CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT Long: Sector: Irrigated agriculture (jute, kale, cabbage, tomato, okra, pepper, amaranthus, pumpkin, watermelon, pig weed) .Town/City: Juba Nabari, South Sudan.Summary: The purpose of this grant is to expand Kuru-ko Wate Self Help's operations as a sustainable farming cooperative and ensure food security and increased income for its members. KKWSH will purchase vegetables from members and process them for resale in commercial markets. Activities will include laying a drip irrigation network to ensure a steady supply of water, procuring farming equipment and inputs as well as two rickshaws for transporting vegetables. Funds will also be used to sponsor financial management, monitoring and evaluation, business management and agronomy training in order to strengthen the capacity of the group.
shortdescription: KURU-KO WATE COMMERCIAL VEGETABLES CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT
longdescription: Sector: Irrigated agriculture (jute, kale, cabbage, tomato, okra, pepper, amaranthus, pumpkin, watermelon, pig weed) .Town/City: Juba Nabari, South Sudan.Summary: The purpose of this grant is to expand Kuru-ko Wate Self Help's operations as a sustainable farming cooperative and ensure food security and increased income for its members. KKWSH will purchase vegetables from members and process them for resale in commercial markets. Activities will include laying a drip irrigation network to ensure a steady supply of water, procuring farming equipment and inputs as well as two rickshaws for transporting vegetables. Funds will also be used to sponsor financial management, monitoring and evaluation, business management and agronomy training in order to strengthen the capacity of the group.

projecttitle: Compass Commercial Vegetable Juba and Terekeka Capacity Building Project
project_descrip: Short: COMPASS COMMERCIAL VEGETABLE JUBA AND TEREKEKA CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT Long: The project funds will be used to improve the business and financial management of Compass and the farmer groups, increase the vegetable production of the farmer groups through trainings, purchasing improved seeds, seedlings, and garden tools, installing drip irrigation and hiring anagricultural extension officer.

longdescription: The project funds will be used to improve the business and financial management of Compass and the farmer groups, increase the vegetable production of the farmer groups through trainings, purchasing improved seeds, seedlings, and garden tools, installing drip irrigation and hiring anagricultural extension officer.

project_descrip: Short: SITE PRESERVATION Long: To support the documentation of monasteries in the World Heritage site of Anuradhapura which date to the 3rd century BC. The introduction of Buddhism to Anuradhapura resulted in a distinctive city plan with concentric rings of monasteries, colosssal irrigation, agricultural fields, and a fortified citadel in the nucleus. The monasteries have a distinctive layout, found only in Sri Lanka. This project will enable the subsequent conservation of the monasteries.  Type:  Archaeology
longdescription: To support the documentation of monasteries in the World Heritage site of Anuradhapura which date to the 3rd century BC. The introduction of Buddhism to Anuradhapura resulted in a distinctive city plan with concentric rings of monasteries, colosssal irrigation, agricultural fields, and a fortified citadel in the nucleus. The monasteries have a distinctive layout, found only in Sri Lanka. This project will enable the subsequent conservation of the monasteries.  Type:  Archaeology

projecttitle: PL-480, Title I Loans - Development Food Aid
project_descrip: Short: FOOD SECURITY PROGRAMMES/FOOD AID Long: The agreement provides $8 million for sales of approximately 58,200 metric tons of U.S.      wheat to the government of Sri Lanka. Revenues generated by sale of the wheat in Sri Lanka will      be integrated into overall development plans to improve food security, reduce rural poverty, and      promote broad-based, equitable, and sustainable agriculture. This agreement will also devote funds      to research in seeds, expansion of wells for irrigation, and the improvement of agricultural marketing      systems in Sri Lanka.
longdescription: The agreement provides $8 million for sales of approximately 58,200 metric tons of U.S.      wheat to the government of Sri Lanka. Revenues generated by sale of the wheat in Sri Lanka will      be integrated into overall development plans to improve food security, reduce rural poverty, and      promote broad-based, equitable, and sustainable agriculture. This agreement will also devote funds      to research in seeds, expansion of wells for irrigation, and the improvement of agricultural marketing      systems in Sri Lanka.

projecttitle: Building the Resilience of Returnees - Agricultural Sector Capacity
project_descrip: Short: BUILDING THE RESILIENCE OF RETURNEES - AGRICULTURAL SECTOR CAPACITY Long: This project will restore the lives and livelihoods of the returnee population, to strengthen resiliency at the household level and to accelerate the process of durable resettlement in key areas of the Northern Province. Support to livelihoods will form a key component of the program. Traditional cash crops including onions, chillies and vegetables will be produced in order to catalyse household income amongst farmers. Communities will also be assisted to revive fisheries with the restoration of productive asset(boats and nets) of fishing families who form the local fishing cooperatives. The activity will also focus on strengthening sustainable economic opportunities of farming families by focusing on improving the rice market. Farming families affected by lack of proper storage for their paddy will be supported by the activity with the establishment of proper storage facilities and training for improved seed paddy production.
shortdescription: BUILDING THE RESILIENCE OF RETURNEES - AGRICULTURAL SECTOR CAPACITY
longdescription: This project will restore the lives and livelihoods of the returnee population, to strengthen resiliency at the household level and to accelerate the process of durable resettlement in key areas of the Northern Province. The activity will also focus on strengthening sustainable economic opportunities of farming families by focusing on improving the rice market. Farming families affected by lack of proper storage for their paddy will be supported by the activity with the establishment of proper storage facilities and training for improved seed paddy production.

projecttitle: Agricultural Sector Productivity - Land and Water Management
project_descrip: Short: AGRICULTURAL SECTOR PRODUCTIVITY - LAND AND WATER MANAGEMENT Long: Agricultural Sector Productivity - Develop and invest in the quantity and quality of land and water resources, including irrigation and soil fertility, riparian and range management, and water resources to improve and sustainably increase agricultural productivity and incomes. This includes related land and water administration systems.

projecttitle: Working for Wellbeing: rebuilding and revitalizing communities through sustainable livelihoods - Strengthen Microenterprise Productivity
project_descrip: Short: WORKING FOR WELLBEING: REBUILDING AND REVITALIZING COMMUNITIES THROUGH SUSTAINABLE LIVELIHOODS - STRENGTHEN MICROENTERPRISE PRODUCTIVITY Long: The project is supported under the Development Grants Program. The project will aim to restore the lives and livelihoods of the returnee population, to strengthen resiliency at the household level and to accelerate the resettlement process in key areas of the Northern Province. Livelihoods will be focused on specialised and high value crops (eg. cashew, subsidiary crops), working with local farmer and fisheries associations and building their capacities and working with communities to improve infrastructure such as irrigation, shelters and community buildings. With the re-establishment of sustainable livelihoods, resettled communities will be able to improve their socio-economic conditions and reduce their dependency on donor assistance.

longdescription: Agricultural Sector Productivity - Develop and invest in the quantity and quality of land and water resources, including irrigation and soil fertility, riparian and range management, and water resources to improve and sustainably increase agricultural productivity and incomes. This includes related land and water administration systems.

projecttitle: Working for Wellbeing: rebuilding and revitalizing communities through sustainable livelihoods
project_descrip: Short: WORKING FOR WELLBEING: REBUILDING AND REVITALIZING COMMUNITIES THROUGH SUSTAINABLE LIVELIHOODS Long: The project is supported under the Development Grants Program. The project will aim to restore the lives and livelihoods of the returnee population, to strengthen resiliency at the household level and to accelerate the resettlement process in key areas of the Northern Province. Livelihoods will be focused on specialised and high value crops (eg. cashew, subsidiary crops), working with local farmer and fisheries associations and building their capacities and working with communities to improve infrastructure such as irrigation, shelters and community buildings. With the re-establishment of sustainable livelihoods, resettled communities will be able to improve their socio-economic conditions and reduce their dependency on donor assistance.

projecttitle: Water and Sanitation Commodities and Services
project_descrip: Short: WATER AND SANITATION COMMODITIES AND SERVICES Long: Procure goods and services, rehabilitate/reconstruct infrastructure, hygiene promotion, training and education, proper preservation, storage, and use of potable water, basic sanitation standards and practices, irrigation, and waste disposal. Activities included herein should be linked to relevant IIP/Health, EG/Environment, and/or EG/Infrastructure activities for surrounding communities. [United Nations Children's Fund]
shortdescription: WATER AND SANITATION COMMODITIES AND SERVICES
longdescription: Procure goods and services, rehabilitate/reconstruct infrastructure, hygiene promotion, training and education, proper preservation, storage, and use of potable water, basic sanitation standards and practices, irrigation, and waste disposal. Activities included herein should be linked to relevant IIP/Health, EG/Environment, and/or EG/Infrastructure activities for surrounding communities. [United Nations Children's Fund]

projecttitle: Supporting Livelihoods in Syria (SLS) Activity
project_descrip: Short: SUPPORTING LIVELIHOODS IN SYRIA (SLS) ACTIVITY Long: This project improves household-level food security and strengthens economic resilience in targeted communities. Interventions focus on agricultural and livestock production, market access, water management, irrigation, and sustainable land techniques to create livelihoods critical for food security. Working jointly with USAIDs Bureau for Humanitarian Assistance, SLS blends the speed of humanitarian assistance with the longer-term focus of development assistance. SLS has helped thousands of farmers with everything from animal feed and vaccinations to drip irrigation systems, with many programs directed toward women-led households. Recently, SLS provided 4,500 farmers in Deir-Ez Zor with farming equipment and 1,900 farmers with veterinary services.

projecttitle: Restoring Livelihoods through Agriculture Revitalization (RLAR)
project_descrip: Short: RESTORING LIVELIHOODS THROUGH AGRICULTURE REVITALIZATION (RLAR) Long: The Restoring Livelihoods through Agriculture Revitalization (RLAR) in Northern Syria. The aim is to enhance resiliency at the household and community level in Syria through reinforcement of agro-ecological systems and improvement of sustainable access to key agriculture inputs and services. In pursuit of this aim, the program is designed to strengthen market access and functionality, strengthen agricultural and livestock production, strengthen livelihood opportunities and value chains critical to food security, improve water management, irrigation and land use techniques, and learning and data collection in Northern Syria.

projecttitle: Conservation of Murals with Tulips and Poppies from Lower Palace of Ancient Panjakent
project_descrip: Short: CONSERVATION OF MURALS WITH TULIPS AND POPPIES FROM LOWER PALACE OF ANCIENT PANJAKENT Long: To support the conservation of murals with tulips and poppies from the 6th-century lower palace (Kainar) at ancient Panjakent. Uncovered in 1897 beneath the ancient citadel, the murals are susceptible to damage from water seepage from a heavily irrigated field in the vicinity. The project involves the consolidation and removal of the murals for conservation and display in the national museum.
shortdescription: CONSERVATION OF MURALS WITH TULIPS AND POPPIES FROM LOWER PALACE OF ANCIENT PANJAKENT
longdescription: To support the conservation of murals with tulips and poppies from the 6th-century lower palace (Kainar) at ancient Panjakent. Uncovered in 1897 beneath the ancient citadel, the murals are susceptible to damage from water seepage from a heavily irrigated field in the vicinity. The project involves the consolidation and removal of the murals for conservation and display in the national museum.

projecttitle: Farmer Advisory Services - Agricultural Sector Capacity
project_descrip: Short: FARMER ADVISORY SERVICES - AGRICULTURAL SECTOR CAPACITY Long: This activity will design and field test participatory agricultural extension and advisory systems across the Feed the Future (FTF) focus area. This final pilot will then be implemented by the new Farmer Advisory Services in Tajikistan Extension Rollout (name TBC) project. FAST will contribute to the extended season vegetable production scaling plan. Future interventions will shift to policy development and support to bolster the Government of Tajikistan's capacity to implement reforms in land distribution, irrigation water management, agriculture regulation, tax regulation, flour fortification, and other agriculture and nutrition reform areas. These activities support the USG Feed the Future initiative.This activity is specific to USAID Tajikistan and is not part of a larger, regional project implemented in other countries within the USAID Central Asia Republics Mission.

projecttitle: Feed the Future Tajikistan Agriculture and Water Project - Agricultural Sector Capacity
project_descrip: Short: FEED THE FUTURE TAJIKISTAN AGRICULTURE AND WATER PROJECT - AGRICULTURAL SECTOR CAPACITY Long: This new activity will improve nutrition through agriculture interventions within the USG Feed the Future (FTF) focus area, 12 districts in western Khatlon Province, by increasing the availability and affordability of nutritious crops and dairy products to reduce stunting and wasting of children. The activity will develop sustainable agriculture value chains with a focus on small holder farmers. The activity will emphasize scaling technologies and support in order to extend the season for vegetable production, increase orchard production, and improving homestead dairy production. The activity will also improve marketing opportunities for farmers. This will be accomplished in part by implementing and scaling up the agriculture advisory services and technologies for vegetable production developed by a current USAID funded activities. The activity will include a water component to continue legal and technical support for Water Users Associations. Water is a foundation activity to any agricultural production program in Tajikistan due to the dominance of irrigated agricultural lands. This water activity will include local, river basin, and national activities. This activity will also include a mass media component to promote public outreach of nutrition sensitive agriculture activities throughout the Feed the Future program in Tajikistan. This activity is specific to USAID Central Asia Mission in Tajikistan and supports implementation of the Feed the Future initiative in Tajikistan. Activities will be consistent with and reinforce the priorities of the Government of Tajikistan and reflect coordination with other donors and other projects, including the World Bank implementation of the multilateral Global Agriculture and Food Security Program (GAFSP) grant in Tajikistan.

This activity is specific to USAID Central Asia Mission in Tajikistan and supports implementation of the Feed the Future initiative in Tajikistan. Activities will be consistent with and reinforce the priorities of the Government of Tajikistan and reflect coordination with other donors and other projects, including the World Bank implementation of the multilateral Global Agriculture and Food Security Program (GAFSP) grant in Tajikistan.
shortdescription: FEED THE FUTURE TAJIKISTAN AGRICULTURE AND WATER PROJECT
longdescription: This new activity will improve nutrition through agriculture interventions within the USG Feed the Future (FTF) focus area, 12 districts in western Khatlon Province, by increasing the availability and affordability of nutritious crops and dairy products to reduce stunting and wasting of children. The activity will develop sustainable agriculture value chains with a focus on small holder farmers. The activity will emphasize scaling technologies and support in order to extend the season for vegetable production, increase orchard production, and improving homestead dairy production. The activity will also improve marketing opportunities for farmers. This will be accomplished in part by implementing and scaling up the agriculture advisory services and technologies for vegetable production developed by a current USAID funded activities. The activity will include a water component to continue legal and technical support for Water Users Associations. Water is a foundation activity to any agricultural production program in Tajikistan due to the dominance of irrigated agricultural lands. This water activity will include local, river basin, and national activities. This activity will also include a mass media component to promote public outreach of nutrition sensitive agriculture activities throughout the Feed the Future program in Tajikistan. This activity is specific to USAID Central Asia Mission in Tajikistan and supports implementation of the Feed the Future initiative in Tajikistan. Activities will be consistent with and reinforce the priorities of the Government of Tajikistan and reflect coordination with other donors and other projects, including the World Bank implementation of the multilateral Global Agriculture and Food Security Program (GAFSP) grant in Tajikistan.

projecttitle: MASAMA MULA COFFEE EXPANSION PROJECT
project_descrip: Short: MASAMA MULA COFFEE EXPANSION PROJECT Long: Sector: Agricutlure. Coffee Production and Processing..Beneficiaries: 988 small holder farmers, of which 298 are women. .The expansion grant to Masama Mula AMCOS Ltd will assist the coffee cooperative society to acquire a new coffee pulping unit to replace the current one that is 56 years old. The USADF grant will also improve the irrigation water system leading to increased coffee yields that were previously adversely affected by dry spells. The grant will create an inputs revolving fund that will complement available limited credit services offered by the AMCOS members Savings and Credit Cooperative Society (SACCOS). Grant funds will meet the technical support needed to enhance better agricultural practices and adoption of new coffee varieties for improved coffee production. The expected immediate impacts will include improved coffee processing which will lead to lower processing costs and improved coffee prices. In the medium and long term members will increase coffee yields by adopting new varieties and better farming practices,

projecttitle: AMHQRM Enterprise Expansion Project
project_descrip: Short: AMHQRM ENTERPRISE EXPANSION PROJECT Long: Azimio is an expansion rice value chain project that has successfully implemented an USADF supported capacity building project. The expansion project is expected to benefit more than 800 smallholder rice farmers at the Azimio Mswiswi irrigation scheme. Through continued USADF grant and technical support the project seeks to complete the on-going construction of its own warehouse and offices on a newly acquired piece of land in Azimio Mswiswi Village. The group also needs to improve the quality of rice they process so as to remain a competitive rice processor and supplier. The group will need a delivery track to ensure members paddy once harvested is delivered to the milling plant in real time so as to minimize post harvest losses.
channelreportedname: Azimio Mswiswi High Quality Rice Millers
longdescription: Azimio is an expansion rice value chain project that has successfully implemented an USADF supported capacity building project. The expansion project is expected to benefit more than 800 smallholder rice farmers at the Azimio Mswiswi irrigation scheme. Through continued USADF grant and technical support the project seeks to complete the on-going construction of its own warehouse and offices on a newly acquired piece of land in Azimio Mswiswi Village. The group also needs to improve the quality of rice they process so as to remain a competitive rice processor and supplier. The group will need a delivery track to ensure members paddy once harvested is delivered to the milling plant in real time so as to minimize post harvest losses.

projecttitle: Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant Project, through AECOM Technology Corporation
project_descrip: Short: REGIONAL WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT PROJECT, THROUGH AECOM TECHNOLOGY CORPORATION Long: This $273,772 grant funded a feasibility study (FS) that assessed wastewater treatment technologies for wastewater reclamation and reuse both within the Rawabi community and for irrigation of agricultural land and industrial sites outside of the Rawabi area. This study aimed to support the development of sustainable infrastructure while also opening up the market to U.S. businesses that could supply state-of-the-art goods and services for project implementation.
shortdescription: REGIONAL WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT PROJECT, THROUGH AECOM TECHNOLOGY CORPORATION
purposename: Water supply and sanitation - large systems
longdescription: This $273,772 grant funded a feasibility study (FS) that assessed wastewater treatment technologies for wastewater reclamation and reuse both within the Rawabi community and for irrigation of agricultural land and industrial sites outside of the Rawabi area. This study aimed to support the development of sustainable infrastructure while also opening up the market to U.S. businesses that could supply state-of-the-art goods and services for project implementation.

projecttitle: Malajajest Fish Farm Project
project_descrip: Short: MALAJAJEST FISH FARM PROJECT Long: The ECHDP proposes to work with the Malajajest Farmer's Cooperative to reinvigorate the fish farm which currently has one pond fully-populated. The construction of the ponds would include wire fencing to keep cattle from the ponds, the refurbishment of the additional five ponds that are currently not under operation. To alleviate the need for early harvesting, the proposal also includes a borehole and pump to irrigate the ponds and keep them full during the dry season. Training in aquaculture would also be provided.

Training in aquaculture would also be provided.

projecttitle: Shashe Fruits and Horticulture Capacity Building Project
project_descrip: Short: SHASHE FRUITS AND HORTICULTURE CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT Long: The project seeks to strengthen Shashe's competitiveness in the orange growth sector by reducing energy costs, increasing water access and providing better training to its membership. Shashe will establish policies and procedures to their strengthen management capacity and internal controls and will develop a business plan.

projecttitle: Kunzwana Energy for Horticulture Entrepreneurship Project
project_descrip: Short: KUNZWANA ENERGY FOR HORTICULTURE ENTREPRENEURSHIP PROJECT Long: Kunzwana Women's Association will launch a solar-powered irrigated produce farm in Zvevahera village including a 6 hectare garden, a borehole, a warehouse, and cold storage facilities to reduce post harvest losses. At least 300 farmers will benefit including 180 women, and farmers will receive agricultural training and linkages to markets.
shortdescription: KUNZWANA ENERGY FOR HORTICULTURE ENTREPRENEURSHIP PROJECT
purposename: Solar energy for isolated grids and standalone systems
longdescription: Kunzwana Women's Association will launch a solar-powered irrigated produce farm in Zvevahera village including a 6 hectare garden, a borehole, a warehouse, and cold storage facilities to reduce post harvest losses. At least 300 farmers will benefit including 180 women, and farmers will receive agricultural training and linkages to markets.

projecttitle: Deure Irrigation Horticulture Production and Marketing Capacity Building Project
project_descrip: Short: DEURE IRRIGATION HORTICULTURE PRODUCTION AND MARKETING CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT Long: The assistance will improve the capacity of management to direct and control operations at Deure through strengthening internal controls and establishing a business plan, policies and procedures. Farmers will be assisted with inputs. Assistance will also provide training in post-harvest handling and storage, enterprise planning, and corporate governance, agronomy and use of good agricultural systems and standards and financial literacy.
shortdescription: DEURE IRRIGATION HORTICULTURE PRODUCTION AND MARKETING CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT
longdescription: The assistance will improve the capacity of management to direct and control operations at Deure through strengthening internal controls and establishing a business plan, policies and procedures. Farmers will be assisted with inputs. Assistance will also provide training in post-harvest handling and storage, enterprise planning, and corporate governance, agronomy and use of good agricultural systems and standards and financial literacy.

projecttitle: MA Horticulture Production and Marketing Capacity Building Project
project_descrip: Short: MA HORTICULTURE PRODUCTION AND MARKETING CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT Long: Sector: Irrigated agriculture.Beneficiaries: 357 producers and 745 employees .Description: The project will improve access to inputs through revolving loan fund and strengthened access to bank loans to enable farmers to increase acreage and yields, establish solar-powered boreholes to increase cropping cycles and save on energy costs and provide a solar powered cold-room to store perishable produce and reduce post-harvest losses of fresh groundnuts and tomatoes. The assistance will improve the capacity of management to direct and control operations at MA through strengthening internal controls and establishing a business plan, policies and procedures, training in post-harvest handling and storage, enterprise planning, and corporate governance, agronomy and use of good agricultural systems and standards and financial literacy.

projecttitle: Feed the Future Zimbabwe  Crop Development (FTF-CD) - Agricultural Sector Capacity
project_descrip: Short: FEED THE FUTURE ZIMBABWE  CROP DEVELOPMENT (FTF-CD) - AGRICULTURAL SECTOR CAPACITY Long: The objective of the new, five-year FTF-CD Program is to increase incomes and food security of 57,500 poor smallholder agricultural producers, thereby reducing household poverty and malnutrition. FY 2015 funds will assist 12,500 smallholder producers on both rain-fed and irrigated land. The program will increase agricultural production and productivity in high-value crops, pulses, and staple food crops.The program will provide technical assistance, training, and facilitation to promote: -Increased productivity, production and quality through application of good agricultural practices and standards-Increased access to credit for agricultural trade, production, and capital investment-Market linkages with input suppliers and buyers-Good nutrition and hygiene through education and behavior change activities-Gender equity and womens empowerment through behavior change activities and womens increased participation in leadership roles and credit opportunities
shortdescription: FEED THE FUTURE ZIMBABWE  CROP DEVELOPMENT (FTF-CD) - AGRICULTURAL SECTOR CAPACITY
longdescription: The objective of the new, five-year FTF-CD Program is to increase incomes and food security of 57,500 poor smallholder agricultural producers, thereby reducing household poverty and malnutrition. FY 2015 funds will assist 12,500 smallholder producers on both rain-fed and irrigated land. The program will increase agricultural production and productivity in high-value crops, pulses, and staple food crops.The program will provide technical assistance, training, and facilitation to promote: -Increased productivity, production and quality through application of good agricultural practices and standards-Increased access to credit for agricultural trade, production, and capital investment-Market linkages with input suppliers and buyers-Good nutrition and hygiene through education and behavior change activities-Gender equity and womens empowerment through behavior change activities and womens increased participation in leadership roles and credit opportunities

projecttitle: CSP
project_descrip: Short: CSP Long: FFP partners with a USAID Implementing Partner to carry out productive asset creation (PAC) activities in vulnerable Zimbabwean communities. In exchange for a household member assisting in constructing or rehabilitating a productive asset—including dip tanks, agriculture projects, irrigation systems, nutrition gardens, dams, and poultry projects—households in need receive food assistance.
longdescription: FFP partners with a USAID Implementing Partner to carry out productive asset creation (PAC) activities in vulnerable Zimbabwean communities. In exchange for a household member assisting in constructing or rehabilitating a productive asset—including dip tanks, agriculture projects, irrigation systems, nutrition gardens, dams, and poultry projects—households in need receive food assistance.
